Reviews.Title: “Good hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: Dan P
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for three nights on our honeymoon and enjoyed every minute of our stay. Our room was clean, comfortable and we slept very well. The hotel was busy from the Saints playing that weekend so we did occasionally hear some noise from people partying in the other rooms but it didn't affect our comfort and sleep. The French Quarter is an old place so we didn't expect it to be like newer construction hotels. Like others have said, the pool area is beautiful and a great place to hang out and have a drink from the bar. Darrell is an excellent, friendly bartender and we loved all of the drinks he made. The kind of service that makes you tip extra from the experience and great service. FYI: if you expect to park at the hotel their valet service is $35/night. Add that to your stay if you plan to use them. Tere are other parking choices nearby but we went with their valet for the convenience. Overall we enjoyed our stay and will definitely stay here again when we come back to New Orleans.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome time in Nola”
Reviews.Author: Irish4052_12
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent a few days in New Orleans in July. We thought the Holiday Inn was great. It is very close to the French Quarter without all the noise. The hotel is very pretty and does have the historical feel. The pool area was very nice and the service was great. The price is so reasonable for such a great location in a big city. I would definitely stay at the Holiday Inn again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location!”
Reviews.Author: NorthbridgeAbby
Reviews.Content: First time to NOLA so we didn't know where to stay. This place was so perfect. Literally a 2 minute walk from the action (Bourbon St) but just far enough so you could not hear all the noise and have too many strange things right out your window. Loved our room. Nothing special but it was big enough, clean enough and had everything we needed. Love the staff! Let us check in a little early and check out a little late. Held our luggage while we waiting to check in. Hotel arrange a bus tour of the town and it was well worth the money. I would go back! I wish they had the bar opened more. Think it was just 3-10pm and wish they had fridge and or microwave in rooms. That's my only recommendations. If you don't care about those, this is the place for you!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel, Great Location!”
Reviews.Author: MissKris_10
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent a few days in New Orleans before and after our cruise. The Chateau LeMoyne was an amazing find! The price was excellent for such a great location I would have expected to pay more. I love how close you are to all the fun on Bourbon Street, yet the hotel is quiet and secure just a few short blocks away. The bed was super comfortable and the staff really makes you feel welcome. The pool area is perfect, the chairs are in superb shape, making it easy to relax and soak up some sun in the beautiful courtyard. My only complaint, the restaurant. Breakfast was WAY overpriced for the quality of food served. We had actually planned on eating in the restaurant for two of the mornings of our stay but after the first experience we decided to dine elsewhere. The restaurant is beautiful and our waiter was very nice but the food was simply awful (burnt english muffin and runny scrambled eggs, anyone?) All in all I would totally stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location! I would highly recommend.”
Reviews.Author: Tracey F
Reviews.Content: I stayed there with a friend for a girls trip around St. Patricks Day. This was my third time to NOLA, my first at Chateau Lemoyne. The location is excellent....very easy walking distance to everything, without the chaos of staying right on Bourbon Street. Even though its a Holiday Inn, it still has the historical feel and look of NOLA. The pool looked nice too, even though we never used it. The staff was friendly and helpful. Chateau Lemoyne would be hard to top, considering the price.

Reviews.Title: “Great experience.”
Reviews.Author: kmfg
Reviews.Content: The valets were extremely informative and polite. I received my car very quickly. Thanks to Bobby. He was a pleasure to work with. He is commended for hiswork service. I would recommend this hotel to a friend.

Reviews.Title: “Nice location”
Reviews.Author: David H
Reviews.Content: Stayed here one night for business, The staff were great and they helped me find what I need to enjoy the night. Very close to all the attractions. Clean and priced right, Would stay there again. Lots of places to eat nearby.

Reviews.Title: “Decent place to stay, but bill really should have been reduced”
Reviews.Author: ladylikesrotts
Reviews.Content: I will begin by saying the rooms are large, which is nearly unheard of in the French Quarter. TV was a nice flat screen, but the decor is dated. I have stayed here many times without incident, however this trip workmen left a door open which allowed mice in. We encountered a mouse in our room and maintence came up promptly with glue traps. (Revolting but we didn't see anymore) The staff with the exception of the valet is very helpful. The valet got a parking ticket in my car and tried to coerce me into paying for it. (The parking company manager said he took care of the ticket) Usually its a nice quiet place, this trip there were hookers fighting with a man under our balcony at 4 am and it took police 45 mins to respond. I spent a week at the hotel and voiced all my concerns to staff who were polite and helpful, but nothing was deducted from my bill,

Reviews.Title: “Great Service. I had trouble with my rental car and the reception straightened it all out!”
Reviews.Author: jcraten
Reviews.Content: There guys are great. I stayed there in April of this year, and I had the most trouble with my unnamed rental car service. These guys were so awesome, the receptionist actually had a friend that worked over there, and she spent a full hour helping me get it all straightened out! 5 stars all the way!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Rah212
Reviews.Content: We stayed here from 11th July â€“ 18th July. We arrived late afternoon and checked in fine. I had requested a smoking room although I intended to just smoke on the balcony as the person I was with was a non-smoker. I explained this to the lady on the front desk and she gave me a non-smoking room with a balcony so that was great. An ashtray was brought up to our room within 2 minutes. Please note the balconies are not private but this wasnâ€™t really a problem. I travel a lot and can honestly say that the beds and pillows were the most comfortable I have ever had. The cleaners were in everyday to make our beds, replace toiletries and clean, I cannot fault them. The staff were all very helpful and friendly and went out of their way to accommodate. They booked us in for trips and were always great at providing tips etc. We never went in the pool because it was always quite busy and we found it a lot smaller than the pictures portrayed but again, that wasnâ€™t really a problem for us. A very minor complaint - They have a computer by the front desk which you pay for. On one occasion it was so slow that by the time my 15 minutes were up, I hadnâ€™t done anything. I mentioned this to the staff who gave me a number to call for me to be reimbursed. I personally do not feel that I should be calling to get my money back but I later found out that it is an external company who provide the internet service so I can understand why I was asked to do this. It did happen again later on in the week but the staff did everything they could to get it resolved asap. The TV had very limited channels which was a little disappointing. I know you donâ€™t go away to watch the TV but I like to watch it while getting ready or if its been a long day/evening, I like to just chill with something good on the box which we didnâ€™t get. Again, this is something very minor. Our room was at the back of the hotel and very loud when out on the balcony (I love people watching so this wasnâ€™t an issue), however, you could hardly hear a thing when the doors were closed so it didnâ€™t disturb our sleep. The location was PERFECT. It couldnâ€™t have been nearer to all the restaurants, Bourbon Street, shops and water front. If you like to people watch like me, make sure you go to The Embers, Original Bourbon Inn and ask for a seat upstairs. The food is amazing and you get a great view of all the goings on. We went there three times and the food was delicious, make sure you try the meatballs! I would also recommend Olde Nawlins Cookery, Red Fish Grill, Palace CafÃ©, DÃ©jÃ  vu and Mr Bâ€™s and The Gumbo Pot. Make sure you have a Hurricane cocktail while here (you can get them pretty much everywhere) For trips, I would definitely recommend the airboat swamp trip, its great fun. We went on the smaller boat but I am sure the bigger one was just as good. We did a two hour tour on the Mississippi River but we personally found that really boring, there really wasnâ€™t anything of interest to look at. All in all this hotel was great. We paid a lot of money for it though and that is the only thing that would prevent me from staying here again which is a shame

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel however very thin walls”
Reviews.Author: 136DGP
Reviews.Content: We spent one night at this hotel and thought it was a beautiful place. It had a large room, beautiful pool area and was in a nice location in the French Quarter. The only complaint is that we heard everything from the room next to us and people on the streets and it wasn't that they were loud it was just poor soundproofing. So if you want a good night sleep may not always be the best choice otherwise it is a great place.

Reviews.Title: “Location, location, LoCaTiOn!”
Reviews.Author: BeachyMiller
Reviews.Content: My husband and I decided to travel to New Orleans for a long weekend. We arrived to the hotel at 10 am so we were not allowed to check in but they did put our bags up so we could hit the quarter until it was time to get our room. When we came back it was packed and probably took us 30 to 45 minutes to get checked in which would have normally been very frustrating but the one gentleman that was trying to check all 20 people in was very nice and I had a very understanding buzz. Our room had 2 full size beds which seemed kind of strange with my 6'2" husband having to sleep in a bed near me but it worked. The room was small but clean and nice. We were only there to sleep so it served its purpose. As I mentioned in the title the hotel has fantastic location. a quick 2 or 3 minute walk and you're on Bourbon St., another 10 and you're at Jackson Square, and a 5 minute walk towards Canal and you can catch a street car. Again, the room was just for us to sleep in so if you're looking for a hotel that you may have to do more then sleep and shower this is probably not the right hotel. However, if you're there to experience Nawlins on a budget this is your place. "Laissez les bons temps router - Let the good times roll!"

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful, great location, friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: ADYost
Reviews.Content: Was worried about finding a hotel in NOLA, but after reading reviews chose Chateau Le Moyne. It was beautiful, clean, friendly staff, and a great location! The pool was beautiful and I felt safe with the security guards outside the front door! My husband and I didn't notice any weird smells in the elevator, hallways, or our room. Can't wait to return to NOLA and stay at Chateau Le Moyne!!

Reviews.Title: “Great spot for a great price”
Reviews.Author: JBlome
Reviews.Content: You can't beat this spot in the French Quarter. Around the corner from Bourbon St. but still, inexplicably quiet. The courtyard pool is small but inviting and very well kept. Beyond that not a ton of bells and whistles but it's New Orleans. If you are there for a hotel then you're missing out.

Reviews.Title: “First visit to New Orleans”
Reviews.Author: Jill C
Reviews.Content: I was a little nervous about going to New Orleans for the first time and spent a long time looking at hotels. The Chateau Lemoyne was a good choice as it was close to all the sights we wished to see without being in the middle of the chaos of Bourbon street. It is hard to believe that you are so near as we heard no noise in the night. The room was perfectly adequate and clean, the bathroom a little small and we had a room with a view of a wall and the edge of the pool. However why would you want to stay in your room when in New Orlean?. All in all a good value for money stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great location in historic New Orleans!”
Reviews.Author: derby3680
Reviews.Content: We stayed here April 4th-6h for the last leg of our Spring Break with the kids. You will indeed get the Bourbon St. experience while staying here. Conveniently located just a couple short blocks to all the action with plenty of options for bars/restaurants all within an easy walking distance. Our kids were 13 & 17 so we did not have to cover their eyes LOL! It might not be the best place for those with young children as they will for sure get "an eyeful". The hotel is exactly as pictured, small double beds and standard size rooms...a bit of a squeeze for family of four. The concierge was "spot on" with his suggestions for restaurants. We did use the pool area...lovely small area...partial shade..nice lounge chairs...not very private as it is in the middle courtyard area. Would stay here again with adults!

Reviews.Title: “A Safe Bet”
Reviews.Author: Qld_Aussie_Expat_
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a safe bet for a value stay in French Quarter. Close enough to all sites and action but just out of the real loud & noisy streets. Check in is quick and friendly and room ( king side balcony) while dated was good size and clean. Small balcony with table & chairs is a nice option for evening drink & passing sites below. Down side is no mimi bar fridge ( they are available upon request on a first come basis apparently, so book one when you make initial reservation if necessary) Bathroom is adequate with ok shower pressure and housekeeping is quick and efficient. TIP; forget paying high price for conducted local tours, just take the red trams to end of line and back and then next day the green tram to cross town garden district and zoo and museums. cost for each ride $2.00 each way!! fantastic. Tip: If you stay during hot weather make sure you top up on ice early as later guests can "run the machine dry" for short time. Overall experience met expectations and would recommend for value stay.

Reviews.Title: “Very happy with our stay!”
Reviews.Author: Mizanders34
Reviews.Content: We stayed here before we took our cruise. Everyone was very friendly and helpful. Valet, while pricey, was very prompt with our car and very personable. I remember one valet team member, Richard, was super! The front desk staff was also wonderful. We actually booked the room on Priceline, and we had never heard of it before. We were very happy!! We had a balcony room, and the street noise was nonexistent. We would love to stay here again!!!

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: chris27tie
Reviews.Content: This hotel is beautiful! The service was great and everyone was helpful! They even booked us a city tour and gave us advice and directions on where to eat. Plan on paying $30-40 to valet your car every night. It is not an option either... well, unless you want to park your car on the street in New Orleans (which is not advised). We left our car in valet and chose to walk everywhere.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Guest Service! Great Room!”
Reviews.Author: Jamienap
Reviews.Content: Staff was so friendly, helpful and knowledgeable -- our stay was amazing. Special thanks to Crystal at the front desk & Ryan in Security. Will definitely return!

Reviews.Title: “Man...Pay The Valet !!!”
Reviews.Author: Stop_At_Red_Lights
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located right in the middle of the French Quarter as mentioned in other reviews. Three observations. 1. Staff is wonderful and nice and rooms are clean and quiet. 2. I didn't know to feel comfortable or uncomfortable by the needed for armed police to be at the front door of the hotel 24-hours-a-day. I felt safer...but then wondered what the need was and if I was safe... 3. Being from Mississippi, I can park my own car. The $38 a night required fee is expensive. And the valet parking is not optional. There is literally no where else to park. My suggestion...add the fee to the room and state is as so. Or give us an option to park your own car. Nice hotel...but just felt odd....but maybe that's part of the ambience.

Reviews.Title: “Showing its age...”
Reviews.Author: saritaT33
Reviews.Content: I spent 3 nights at the Holiday Inn on Dauphine last week, and was slightly disappointed with my stay. I stayed at this same hotel in 2010, and during that time I thought the rooms were quite nice, the location was perfect, and the prices were reasonable. Consequently, I booked my recent stay without hesitation. Unfortunately, the hotel has aged quite a bit over the past two years. The lobby and the grounds (pool/restaurant) are substantially the same, and our hotel room (#308) was clean enough, but--it was somehow lacking in comfort. The bathroom sink drain didn't work properly, there was mold in the shower, and the windows needed to be cleaned. To be fair, we did get a good night's rest and the location simply cannot be beat (close to the action, but quiet). However, the overnight parking fees ($35) and the slightly creepy room can't overcome these advantages. Perhaps a renovation is in order? Two and a half stars for the room, plus an extra half star for the location.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay”
Reviews.Author: IntravenusDMilo13
Reviews.Content: My only suggestion would be having mini-fridges standard in the rooms. Staff was lovely, grounds were beautiful, and it was in the perfect location. I would recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Great place in the French Quarter”
Reviews.Author: Stephen E
Reviews.Content: We stayed here on a Saturday. Started off great with prompt Valet service and check in. Room was comfortable and the bar downstairs was good.

Reviews.Title: “Great location in French Quarter”
Reviews.Author: global_freq_traveler
Reviews.Content: I chose this place after reading a couple of reviews. I like the central location in the French Quarter, the area can be conveniently explored on foot. The room was quiet as it faced the court with the pool; the ubiquitous noise from Bourbon St did not disturb. The room was very large, the bathroom a bit tiny, but ok. The atmosphere of the hotel is much nicer than I expected for a property of this chain. One of the receptionist was super friendly and helpful with tips, another one reserved and not helpful at all. I'd not recommend this place for business travelers, as printing is only possible down in the lobby at their one and only public computer. Use of this computer is charged to your credit card. Valet parking is USD 34.95 + tax (+ tip), so one might consider an alternative way of getting there and away, or park the car elsewhere. The price for the room itself appeared adequate. If I should return to this city I would probably try out one of the beautiful boutique hotels that are scattered in the area.

Reviews.Title: “Tiny room and bathroom...”
Reviews.Author: Vicki4141
Reviews.Content: The location is not bad, it's walking distance from some restaurants/shopping. Must pay $35 for over night parking, outdoor pool/no sauna, small pond in court yard w/a few small turtles, mosquitos may bit if your prone, small room, no refrigerator or microwave, must squeeze into bathroom to get the door closed.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful!!!”
Reviews.Author: Andrea R
Reviews.Content: This hotel was the ideal location for traveling to the French Quarter. The staff was EXCEPTIONAL! Our tire had gone flat sometime during the weekend, and they took it upon themselves to have it patched up for us. I will come back to this hotel the next time I am in New Orleans.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Value Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Mike P
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Holiday Inn Chateau Lemoyne for 8-11 June. The rooms are very clean and well kept, and were surprisingly large for a value hotel in the French Quarter. The location is perfect: only one block from Bourbon Street, and easily within walking distance to visit anything in the French Quarter. The pool and central courtyard are definitely worth checking out. I will gladly recommend this hotel to my friends and people planning to visit New Orleans.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, Nice property & professional staff!”
Reviews.Author: Linda P
Reviews.Content: The Chateau Le Moyne Holiday Inn is in a perfect location in the French Quarter, a block away from the craziness on Bourbon St. We got a fantastic deal on Priceline and were expecting a standard room for the price. The pleasant hotel clerk upgraded our room much to our delight, without us asking and the concierge also went above an beyond to assist us with information and suggestions for places to dine and possessed an "can do" attitude. Nice pool area to cool off in during the midday NOLA heat. It is definitely a three star establishment, not super luxurious but the beds were comfy and the location superb! If you can get a deal on Priceline, etc, it's a great value.

Reviews.Title: “Walking distance to everything”
Reviews.Author: Binnidm
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel, beautiful pool and courtyard. One block off Bourbon Street. The hotel is older, rooms nice. Noise was not an issue. I don't get the small pillows, which I have seen at other Holiday Inns, weird. We felt safe walking. An easy walk to Bourbon street, Jackson Square, the French Market, and the Mississippi shore. The staff went out of their way to help. The concierage was helpful in booking a tour for us. Overall a great location and we would definately return.

Reviews.Title: “perfect for a 3 day stay in the quarter”
Reviews.Author: jimmywdo
Reviews.Content: was in NOL A for a wedding-for the weekend- hotel rooms were very clean and quiet ( a block from all the crazyness on Bourbon St.- )was close enough to walk anywhere in the in the quarter--staff / concierge/front desk was helpful--courtyard with pool was beautiful and relaxing---there is a cigar friendly bar/ lounge off the main lobby that was nice --didnt eat in the restaurant -so cant comment on that----all in all a very nice hotel to stay at thats close to all the fun--but not too close-- price was reasonable--the rooms were not spectacular, but were clean--the hotel is in a safe location-----would highly recommend this hotel if your looking for a reasonably priced hotel in a safe area which is within walking distance to all the quarter attractions--and a short cab ride away to the garden disrtict, downtown areas etc ($10-$15) -it was the perfect place for our weekend trip to NOLA

Reviews.Title: “Very convenient location, friendly staff, clean rooms.”
Reviews.Author: jlyjoe
Reviews.Content: Some friends and i stayed here for Mardi Gras. It was in the perfect location in the quarter. I can't say anything bad about this hotel. It was perfect!

Reviews.Title: “Well located for the Quarter; a good stay”
Reviews.Author: Jon9769
Reviews.Content: My family and I have been staying here on and off for 20 years and keep coming back, and have never had any problems. Most of our visits are with our relatives here, so we generally don't come during the really crazy times like Mardi Gras or Jazz Fest. The hotel rooms are what you'd expect from any other Holiday Inn -- comfortable, clean, with the standard amenities, including an in-room safe, which is for some reason harder to find in some hotels these days. There are a variety of rooms, since the hotel is made up of renovated 18th-century buildings and modern buildings, so some rooms have nice touches like balconies, or original brickwork. The central courtyard houses a small pool and chairs, which do fill up pretty quickly, but you probably didn't come to the French Quarter to spend the entire day in the pool. There is a restaurant which serves a full breakfast -- it's pretty standard American fare. It's good food, but if you're looking for some local flavor, you're going to be disappointed. There's also a lounge, and the bartender was very friendly. They have a concierge (a rare feature these days) who is very knowledgeable, and the valet and bell staff are happy to call you a cab if you need it. Valet parking will give you sticker shock if you're from somewhere other than New York or Boston, but it's pretty standard for the Quarter. The room rates are pricey, but not excessive for the location, which itself is quite good. 1 block to Bourbon, 2 blocks to Canal and the streetcars, and short walks to Jackson Square, the riverfront, the aquarium, and more. As with any hotel in the Quarter, you're guaranteed one night where drunken college kids come in at 4am and stand in the hallway loudly talking about their adventures on Bourbon St. Bring some earplugs and it'll be fine.

Reviews.Title: “we loved our room”
Reviews.Author: StCharlesLA
Reviews.Content: This is a nice hotel in a great location in the heart of the French Quarter. The staff is professional, courteous, and helpful. Valet parking puts your car in a lot right across the street, available for easy in-and-out access at a moment's notice. Public areas inside the hotel include a comfortable lobby, a spacious restaurant, and a nice pool and surrounding area in the relaxing courtyard. The hotel's exterior blends nicely into the classic European architecture of the French Quarter. Of course, there are many choices of rooms and suites, and we loved our room. It had two beds and a balcony facing Bienville Street (See Tip #1 below). It was so serene...spending time on the balcony enjoying a glass of wine late at night or sipping coffee early in the morning; with a backdrop of seemingly never-changing historic architecture and a parade of ever-changing characters passing below, it's a great place for reflection and relaxation. Back inside, the room was adequately spacious, extremely comfortable, and met all our needs. There is a safe in the closet to protect your valuables. Tip #1 - When available, the hotel offers free upgrades to members of their great Priority Club frequent guest program who have accumulated enough points. We were thrilled to be offered this upgrade, even without asking. Tip #2 - Get their credit card, really! You get a free night at any of their hotels each year and lots and lots of points, which translate to additional free nights. You can't beat it. They waive the $49 fee the first year after which you can cancel, but even after that, the benefits greatly outweigh the fee. Tip #3 - It's just steps from three of the highest-rated restaurants in this culinary capital. Do try G.W. Fins for fresh seafood, excellently prepared. Do try Arnaud's for classic New Orleans dishes from a hundred years ago - very exquisite. Don't try Bayona, it is overrated and overpriced.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad for the price and location”
Reviews.Author: Luis M
Reviews.Content: Like alot of the area this is an older place. However; it is clean and the staff is friendly. 1 street over from bourbon st. but pretty quiet so when you are done parttying you can still get some sleep. I didnt get in the pool but there seemed to be quite a few people enjoying it. Staff was friendly and they had security outside also.Parking is valet or you can park yourself just about half a block away which I did. I would stay here again. No complaints

Reviews.Title: “Perfectly charming and delightful.”
Reviews.Author: Mayasbubbe
Reviews.Content: This lovely hotel is in a prime location. It's around the corner from. Bourbon Street and near some wonderful restaurants. The rooms are beautifully decorated. The courtyard pool is a wonderful respite from the heat and noise of the city. The staff was extremely helpful and pleasant. I highly recommend this moderately priced hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Extra fees charged on my credit card without explanation”
Reviews.Author: Zotcor
Reviews.Content: Very happy with this Hotel. Good location, good room, nice swiming pool. Only bad points are that for the price the breakfast could be included and fees have been charged on my credit card without my agreement and when I tried to contact the hotel to have an explanation they never reply my messages. Be caraful !

Reviews.Title: “Location, service, and clean!”
Reviews.Author: TammyJean315
Reviews.Content: I just stayed here and I have to say it was one of the best places I had ever stayed on vacation. The staff there was amazing. Being from out of town I had tons of dumb questions and they where right there to help me out. No matter how many times I asked. The gentlemen working the valet where prompt with picking up my car when I called down. Where always there to open my door when I pulled up. There was 24 hour valet and gentlemen working security. I never felt worried once coming in late at night. They where right there to greet and keep the drunks out. The rooms where clean and the bed where comfortable. I didn't have that in easy feeling of strange beds with dirty sheets. I will be recommending this Place to anyone going to New Orleans.

Reviews.Title: “My first choice for hotels in the French Quarter”
Reviews.Author: AZSailor12
Reviews.Content: This has become our favorite hotel in the Quarter. It is close enough to Bourbon, yet very quiet, ensuring a good nights sleep. This is a historic hotel, so don't expect completely modern furnishings, but we like it. Try one of the suites, 207 and 307, I think. Service is very good, with friendly, competent staff.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Dawn L
Reviews.Content: Love this hotel, i will always go back everytime i visit NOLA, Jeffery was the best at helping us with attractions and dining and fun!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great location and staff!”
Reviews.Author: timac19
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights this past weekend on our first trip to NOLA. This is a great location, ideal for walking everywhere in the FQ and Canal street. It was our anniversary and upon check in the young girl said she was looking for the best room for us (I think her name was Brittany?!)...we had a nice room with king size bed (very comfy!!) and huge windows with balcony (no chairs) overlooking Dauphine street. There was a little street noise but we didn't care, the hotel itself was quiet, pool was nice even though we didn't use it. We felt safe here and walked all over. Concierge and security guards all friendly and helpful, thanks for making our stay memorable!

Reviews.Title: “Awesome location and great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: 2BNLA
Reviews.Content: We went to New Orleans to celebrate a friend's 40th birthday and stayed at this hotel. It is a fantastic old hotel with lots of character and charm. The staff was top notch including the security guard at night who made sure no random souls wandered in. The location is perfect and easily within walking distance of Bourbon St and the casino on Canal St. Highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Tip. Hungry Bellman”
Reviews.Author: Bigjoe12
Reviews.Content: Real nice hotel had a lot of fun with the fam real nice security just one bad thing was this bellmen guy Allen would not even open the door for us real rude guy if u ever go to this hotel stay out his way

Reviews.Title: “Very nice and convenient to everything!”
Reviews.Author: dgonsoulin
Reviews.Content: This hotel is first class all the way. From the minute we drove up to the door, I felt at home. It was a nice hotel, great clean lobby with a wonderful courtyard in the center with a swimming pool surrounded by balconies. I didn't get to eat at the cafe inside the hotel, but I did look at the menu and there were a few things I wish I could have tried. Our room had a balcony that over looked Bienville Ave. I thought we were getting on on Dauphine St, but that's OK. I recommend this hotel, however, not at the price that I paid. It was the weekend of the NCAA Finals and with the tax and parking it was over $500! I think half that price is fair. The same room we had is about $100 when there are no special events in NOLA, which is about 1/2 the time! One other thing that wasn't up to snuff was that there is no assistance at night. I mean that we had spilt a glass of water on the bed and asked for a new set of sheets, we left for a hour, when we came back there was a pile of clean sheets on the chair. We had to change them ourselves. The best thing about this hotel is the parking. You will NEVER find a place to park in the Quarter ANYWHERE during a big event unless you pay. Even though the parking at the Lemoyne is $34, it is well worth it. Just being able to get your car and go when ever you want and know you will have your spot when you come back is a luxury any New Orleanian appreciates. And having a nice full bar downstairs is nice. All expected luxuries are here including good wi-fi reception in our second floor room.

Reviews.Title: “Great location terrible service”
Reviews.Author: jbeans85
Reviews.Content: The hotel itself has great potential. Located in the french quarter steps from Bourbon St it's an older charming building with decent size rooms and a nice pool / courtyard area. Its downfall was the service. The first night we arrived after hours of travel all my friends and I wanted to do was take a nice shower. To our disappointment, after one person showered, the drain clogged. We called the desk for assistance with this and more towels and were rudely told no one could help us until morning and if we wanted more towels we would have to get them ourselves. The next day the drain was fixed but we had to get extra towels ourselves daily since the person who serviced our room continued to provide us with only two after we told them we were four people. Also during our stay my friend left her prescription sunglasses in the lobby bathroom prior to us getting on a tour bus. She called the front desk to ask if someone could please get the glasses for her and hold them at the desk until we came back. After the rude desk agent put her on hold and "disconnected" her THREE times someone finally "went to look" and informed her they were not there. When we returned from the tour we decided to check the desk in case someone had turned in the glasses. The new person working informed us that a guest had found them in the bathroom exactly where she had left them and turned them in! So no one had checked the bathroom when she asked! We were disgusted. I would suggest this hotel for its great location only.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location”
Reviews.Author: Tracy H
Reviews.Content: We stayed here 4 nights during our trip and found this hotel to be very good. Yes its old and a little bit dated but we felt safe and comfortable here. We walked everywhere and we were able to see all the local sights. We habd breakfast in the breakfast room every morning and it was enough to see us through the day. The staff there were friendly and made us feel welcome.

Reviews.Title: “Chateau Lemoyne”
Reviews.Author: falcon635
Reviews.Content: An older, nice hotel one block over from Bourbon St. Valet parking only - you had to pay $34.95 per night to park and then tip the valet to park and retrieve your car. Checking around, all the hotels do this - so plan on it. Very nice front desk person checking us in. Felt that Todd, the manager, went out of his way to accommodate us. I had prepaid with the provision that I could not cancel nor change our reservation. I had a medical problem and spoke with Todd directly and he kindly changed our reservation to the following week at the same price. Valets were helpful in giving directions, although there was a concierge in the lobby. Our room happened to be in the front and we did hear street noises during the night, but that was to be expected. Bring ear plugs and live with it. Our room was huge - a second king bed would fit. Bath rather small - had to move the coffee machine off the counter to make room for all our "stuff". But no big deal - everything was nice and clean. There a a restaurant that serves breakfast only and a nice bar. The only reason I gave this four stars was because the carpet had a slight smell to it - like it needed to replaced in the near future. Would stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location and great service!”
Reviews.Author: luv2goontrips
Reviews.Content: We were there during the Final Four weekend and the hotel was very full but check in/check out was flawless. We loved the convenience to downtown & being only 1 block from Bourbon St. So close to restaurants and shops so you can easily walk. The pool was a bonus but we were so busy with our basketball and concert filled 4 days that we didn't get to use it. The only downside of our stay was the smoking room. When we made reservations it was all that was available. We brought air freshner with us but you just can't get that smell out of there. Otherwise we would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Location, location, location!”
Reviews.Author: Don P
Reviews.Content: This is a basic mid-range hotel in a terrific location. One block from Bourbon street. Easy walking distance to all points in the French Quarter. The staff is very helpful.

Reviews.Title: “It is Okay”
Reviews.Author: DiabloDeb
Reviews.Content: We stayed there at perfect time, although Spring Break, we were after the hustle & bustle of Mardis Gras and left right before the NCAA Final Four. Now I should point out that it is very important if staying here to tell the cab driver that you want to go to Chateau Lemoyne, do no use the word Holiday Inn or you end up at another H.I. 13 blocks away on Royal St. I was told that the locals simply call it Chateau Lemoyne. We arrived early having come in from a cruise that morning and were told check-in was 4 pm which I more or less expected. We checked our bags and decided to grab breakfast at the little restaurant within the hotel that only serves breakfast. This is by far one of the worse places I have ever been to, not only was the food horrible but the service was the worst I have experienced. Upon entering, they don't have a sign or anything to tell you to wait to be seated or to just pick a seat. After waiting a few minutes we saw a waitress at other tables that didn't even have the courtesy to tell us to sit wherever we wanted. Finally after we were seated our waiter appears with menus and takes our order which he got half of it wrong. This may seem like a strange complaint but our food came way too fast, as in, it was already partially made but the eggs were severely under cooked. The waiter pretty much tossed our plates at us and muttered something that sounded like "I have to go to the bathroom" and ran out the door. Ten minutes later, we finally had to flag down the waitress waiting on the other tables to get another juice but then our waiter returned and got it for us, he brings it out immediately and said, "Whew, I really had to go to the bathroom!" now these are words anybody dining needs or wants to hear. Needless to say, we didn't drink the juice. The location is both good and bad. Good points are that you are in the French Quarter and you are a block over from Bourbon Street which means that is is a short walk but at night when it is loud (on the weekends) you can still hear the hootin' and howlerin' in your room. You are also very close to Saint Louis Cemetery #1. The bad side is that you are kind of on the outskirts of where most of the shopping and dining is, not far enough to need a cab but if you are someone that has limited range for walking this would prove to be a hike. It also is not very populated or well lit at night. The concierge desk is nice and helpful, we booked a tour with them that went really smooth. Often times the bellman was there and he was eager to give directions and recommendations for places to eat and things to do. There is also an armed guard on duty, not sure if this is common for the area or just this hotel but nonetheless makes one think. The check-in/out desk staff was void of personality and not at all friendly. The hotel could really use a remodel, desperately. The room was a nice size, we were on the 4th. floor with a balcony over the street. The room wasn't dirty but worn out, no lock on the bathroom door, shower curtain had some tears, and while they had a desk and a table in the room they chose the bathroom location for the in-room coffeemaker and as we all know, a breeding ground for germs. The French door that leads out to the balcony has two locks, a bolt into the floor and another into the ceiling which are not easily opened and if you are short you will have a hard time with the ceiling lock. Also the railing was falling apart with no attempt to repair, not a hazard but aesthetically not very pleasing. There are two elevators at the hotel and to be nice, I will say I am so glad I made it out of there and don't have to ride in them again. The one elevator on the right you could hear a cable banging up against the side of it which was not a very comforting sound, We had requested a late check out and they said they couldn't tell us anything until the morning of check-out and then they extended it a whole hour, wow! Considering the day before the maid didn't even make it to the room until after 3 pm which is humorous because there is a note on the Do Not Disturb sign that states that if you leave it on the door after 9 am or something like that, then your room won't be cleaned until after 2 pm. Maybe we should have put it out, she may have come sooner. Would I recommend this hotel? It is hard to say, since I haven't stayed anywhere else in the French Quarter before so I am not sure if this below or above average standards.

Reviews.Title: “Rude Rude Rude”
Reviews.Author: Bob-Mary
Reviews.Content: I arrived at this hotel at 10am and requested early check in. The woman at the front desk, Renee, said check in is at 4pm. I was polite and asked if anything might be available earlier? She stated 4pm is the best she could do. I asked if I could give her my cell number so she could call me if something came up. She seemed put off but wrote it down. There were no other people in line and she wasnt busy so she clearly wasnt stressed. A friend later told me that he checked in at 12:30pm. We checked our luggage with the bellman and walked around. We came back at 2pm just to check and she was checking in other people. I stood at the front desk and stared her down. After she checked in everyone, I walked up and just looked at her. She said something to the effect that my room might be available. Of course it was! She clearly had no interest in trying to help me before. My wife and I travel all over the world and often get to hotels early. Every other time, the front desk has gone out of their way to accomodate us. In this instance, this woman went out of her way to NOT accomodate us. In addition, this Holiday Inn is no better than any other Holiday Inn. If anything, it is dirtier.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location for the city and the French Quarter; large comfortable rooms; attitude slightly lacking”
Reviews.Author: SCAN60
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located right in the French Quarter of New Orleans â€“ the historic part of the city and the centre for the plethora of bars and night cubs for which the area is famous. We stayed for three nights. This is a very compact area of the city and the hotel is closely surrounded by other buildings. The only open exterior area is in the middle of the hotel surrounded on all four sides by the hotel itself. There is no self-parking. Valet parking at a fairly high daily cost ($35 at the time of writing) is offered. The reception area is smaller than many Holiday Inns but is nicely furnished. Our welcome from the staff was good, but there was only one person on duty at the time (a pattern that seemed to occur whenever we passed the desk), so we did have to wait for some time before we were attended to. Interior public areas are non-smoking. Smoking rooms are available. There is an outdoor pool in the central area mentioned above, and complimentary WiFi throughout. Despite the compact area of the city, rooms are very spacious, clean, and well maintained. In common with other hotels in the chain, the bed, in particular, was excellent. Some rooms do have a very restricted view. I noted a document behind the reception desk listing certain rooms that overlook a brick wall and an instruction to staff not to issue these to the chainâ€™s loyalty club members. Despite my membership, I did, indeed, get such a room. I understand the hotel has certain superior rooms, some of which have a balcony, but I canâ€™t comment on these. Standard equipment including TV, coffee maker (more on that below), microwave, refrigerator, iron, hairdryer etc., were all present and correct. The hotel and rooms are air-conditioned throughout. The hotel was fairly busy whilst we were there and there was some noise penetration into the room from other guests. Itâ€™s my preference to drink Hot Tea (rather than coffee) in my room. Despite the promise on the web site of a â€œtea makerâ€�, I wasnâ€™t at all surprised (given the country I was in) to find no tea bags in the room, so I called at reception who directed me to the restaurant. Staff there initially wanted to levy a charge for tea bags. Bearing in mind that we were paying around $130 per room per night (inc. taxes), and that I would not, of course, be using the supplied coffee, I felt this represented a very poor attitude. After some debate the waitress eventually generously gave me two (yes, TWO) tea bags for my three-night stay. I didnâ€™t dare ask for milk! (Powdered non-dairy creamer doesnâ€™t make for a good cup of tea). Not good. I had to buy provisions from a nearby supermarket. There is a restaurant and bar. We did not take dinner nor breakfast so I canâ€™t comment on the standard of the food offering. In summary, this hotel represents a very good choice for both comfort and location and, if it werenâ€™t for the question mark over the extent to which their general attitude honours the Holiday Inn promise to ensure everything needed for a good stay, and that very high charge for parking, I would be happy to recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Really enjoyed my stay”
Reviews.Author: HeavenAF
Reviews.Content: The location was fantastic, just a few streets and a few minute walk from Bourbon street (which really comes in handy when you are coming back at night). The staff was nice and helpful and even let me check out late. The rooms were clean and the hotel in general had a cute European feel. Don't let the "Holiday Inn" name fool you, it is not at all what I expected! Oh and the beds were super comfy!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location for nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: UltimateSports
Reviews.Content: 1 block off of Bourbon and 2 from Canal. Can't beat this location as its quiet but close to whatever you'd like to do in the French Quarter or Business District.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice, Great Location!”
Reviews.Author: texasbarb
Reviews.Content: This was our 1st visit to New Orleans-Feb 28-Mar 3, 2012. Our stay was made more enjoyable because everyone of the staff we encounterd was helpful beyond our expectations. Our room was reasonably sized but the bathroom was small. Our room did not come with a mini-fridge, however, we were offered a complimentary fridge...PERFECT! the fridge was brought to our room moments after we entered it. The hotel is a group of older buildings surrounding a lovely interior pool & courtyard. Everything we saw was well kept. Since we drove, we had to valet the car...$35/day...pricey but the parking lot was behind locked fences. There is no free breakfast at this hotel. The resturant is only open for breakfast. We found the service to be mediocre. The concierge was extremely helpful. We booked a tour through him with VIP City Tours and got a bit of a discount. My husband is not able to walk more than a couple blocks and the concierge suggested using pedi-cabs. This was a wonderful and helpful hint. It allowed my DH to see a lot of the French Quarter he would otherwise not have seen. The noise on Bourbon Street is LOUD. The hotel is amazingly quiet...what a difference just a block makes! Another nice amenity is free high-speed internet available in the rooms. I would highly recommend staying at Chateau LeMoyne. The cost of our room was reasonable for the area for the Tuesday-Thursday portion of our stay. However, the price increased dramatically for Friday night. Plan your stay during the week if you want to save some money.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Jenny A
Reviews.Content: This was a fabulous hotel for the price - we stayed three nights. Bed are doubles not queens. It was only a block off bourbon but far enough to get away from the noise. The staff was very helpful and super friendly. Loved the pool and courtyard. Overall would go and recommend to anyone!

Reviews.Title: “Feb 12”
Reviews.Author: HattieTicToc
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Chateau Lemoyne from 1st - 4th Feb and found it to be very good. The room was comfortable, staff very informative and helpful, pool area very clean. Breakfast was a bit slow. We had no noise from Bourbon Street, even though Mardi Gras was just beginning, and thought the hotel was in a very good central position. Would definately stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, good basic hotel”
Reviews.Author: Lasuvera
Reviews.Content: A solid choice for a stay in the French Quarter with an excellent location. Rooms on the 4th floor have nice balconies with nothing above them, however some rooms share a balcony with another room. Room 414 has it's own balcony and is just perfect for a view.

Reviews.Title: “1 night stay”
Reviews.Author: ls123sm
Reviews.Content: Def close to bourbon. Restroom small. beds arent queens, they are double beds. great location, good price. def would stay again

Reviews.Title: “1 week stay @ Chateau Lemoyne”
Reviews.Author: Tim M
Reviews.Content: My wife and I really liked the hotel, great location near all French Quarter attractions yet very quiet street and area. Staff was super helpful especially Alan our concierge who hooked us up with tour discounts and where to and not to eat. We walked to the new Rouses mkt @ 701 Baronne and brought back prepared food and wine and dined out side by the pool which is heated to 80 degrees so bring your suit. We also rented bikes around the corner from Ryan @ American Bike Rental and cruised the Garden and Warehouse districts. In retro we might have included the breakfast-parking deal as we rented a car for a few days. The armed security guys were really cool and made us feel safe, great hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel in good location”
Reviews.Author: vbriz
Reviews.Content: We were looking for a reasonalby priced hotel in the French Quarter and stumbled on this very nice hotel. It was conveniently located, very comfortable and clean. The staff was very well informed and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location”
Reviews.Author: Teachall
Reviews.Content: Good location to The French Quarter area. Robert the Porter/Door attendant very friendly. Bathrooms are small. Room was adequate. Outdoor pool heated, & the courtyard was very nice. Rooms could be updated, but considering what Katrina did to the city, this room is fine. Extra charge for Valet parking. No choice, you have to use this service.

Reviews.Title: “Bienville Lounge at the Chateau Lemoyne”
Reviews.Author: punkinlr
Reviews.Content: Our friends stayed at the hotel and said it was a great place to stay. We met them for "before Bourbon Street" cocktails! Eddy, the bartender was fantastic. A quaint little lounge, quiet enough for conversation, but alive enough to have a great time. No rush, laid back, reasonably priced and great drinks. Located like 2 blocks from Bourbon Street. Easy to find and easy to get to.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, but watch your hotel account!”
Reviews.Author: Alan P
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a week mid January 2012 with my wife. I originally asked for either a courtyard view room or an accessible room; I received neither (however our bathroom was large but could not be classed as an accessible room). The location of the hotel was excellent; just a 5 minute walk from both Canal Street and the Jackson Square area. The hotel was clean and tidy and the staff were very friendly and helpful and will do pretty much anything you ask of them. One very important point: watch your hotel account VERY carefully! I was charged accommodation on a daily basis and taken from my credit card also on a daily basis, although I had already paid in full! It took me 2 days to convince them of their mistake and 3 weeks to have it refunded to my credit card! All in all a nice place to stay and yes I would recommend it. BAD POINTS: A little tired and could do with updating. Only meal available at the hotel is breakfast which is charged extra (unless you go B&B I suppose). Room Service breakfast costs extra (20% I think). Telephone calls using the room phone are VERY expensive (buy a phone card). Credit Card accounting mistakes seem to be common! (Read other reviews) GOOD POINTS: Very good location. Cheap â€˜does what it says on the tinâ€™ hotel. Friendly helpful staff Nice courtyard with heated swimming pool. Armed doorstaff! VERY noisy air con units.

Reviews.Title: “Charming Hotel in the City Center”
Reviews.Author: Ms_Marquez
Reviews.Content: Holiday Inn (Chateau Lemoyne) has a very unique set up using homes to create a charming hotel with a great outdoor pool (for the cooler months it would be nice to have an indoor pool but that is not as common in the south). The location is perfect for walking around the French Quarter (close to Bourbon Street, The French Market, Steamship Natchez and all sightseeing milestones). Parking is difficult so we were glad that we did day trips that picked up from the hotel and took a cab from the airport. The concierge and 24 hour security made us feel safe and well informed about the city. Clean rooms, excellent restaurant reccommendations and friendly people. We definitely want to return to New Orleans and if we do we will stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and Staff helpful”
Reviews.Author: LatinDrummer
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel from January 19-22, 2012. This is a great location just one block up from Bourbon Street. They had 24 hour security and the staff was very helpful with tours and directions as well as suggestions for restaurants. All of their suggestions were spot on. The rooms were clean and comfortable but I was a little let down as the website made the rooms look recently upgraded. There were flat screens in the rooms and the rooms were a reasonable size but the bathrooms were very small even in an upgraded suite (two people at a time providing one of you is in the shower). Beds were good.

Reviews.Title: “New Years Eve”
Reviews.Author: JerryD_2011
Reviews.Content: This is a great Hotel with a great Location. The rooms were awesome and I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “A decent hotel with a great location in the French Quarter”
Reviews.Author: MikeLisaAnna
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Chateau Lemoyne for three nights earlier this month. The hotel is not overly fancy, but has a great location only a block from Bourbon Street. You get some occasional street noise from drunks walking home after a night on nearby Bourbon Street, but it was never a problem for us to sleep through. The rooms were clean and had what we needed - comfortable beds, safe, cable TV, free WiFi, iron and ironing board, good water pressure in the shower. The staff was friendly and gave us a good restaurant recommendation one night. We did not use the restaurant, since we were at out each night. We also did not get a chance to use the outdoor swimming pool, because it was too cold outside to swim. Our one complaint was that the hotel has an 11AM checkout time, which is too early in a late-night nightlife city like New Orleans. Noon or 1PM would be much more reasonable.

Reviews.Title: “Great location!”
Reviews.Author: Jasubar
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel in a great location that we got for a steal considering how much was going on in NOLA at the time. My husband said I shouldnâ€™t write such a good review because next time we wonâ€™t be able to get a room here, but here we go. The night before, while driving from Chicago to NOLA, we stayed at a Holiday Inn in Memphis that robbed us of a good nightâ€™s sleep. So here, we specifically requested a quiet room away from the elevators. We were given a room SO quiet, it almost felt like we were out in the country. Hard to believe we were only a block from Bourbon St. Our room faced a small courtyard, not the main courtyard with the pool, that we never saw anyone go into. Everything was sparkling clean and everything that was supposed to work, worked well. Beds were extremely comfortable. Iâ€™ve seen other reviews mention the odd-shaped square pillows, but theyâ€™re square only because the pillowcases were folded and tucked around the pillows that way. All you have to do is untuck the case, shake out the pillow and itâ€™s a normal pillow. In fact, you have a selection of soft and firm pillows to choose from. Even the soft pillows offered good support and I didnâ€™t wake up with the neck ache I often get from my own pillows at home. I even thought about trying to buy some of the hotelâ€™s pillows as replacements. Staff were all very friendly. Yes, parking is quite expensive, but thatâ€™s to be expected in a city where a car isnâ€™t necessary to get around and parking spots are not abundant. Just a few doors down from the hotel is an excellent restaurant called Louisiana Bistro that we will certainly visit again on our next trip to NOLA.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing location, simple rooms, and fantastic service! (travel agent review)”
Reviews.Author: Jooolz1976
Reviews.Content: I spent Christmas with my mother in New Orleans (strange, right? It was okay except everything was closed and it rained the entire time heheh) We stayed at the Holiday Inn Chateau LeMoyne Dec 24 - 27/2011. We originally had a standard room that I liked! It had exposed brick and was large. My mother smokes, however, so the hotel gave us a balcony room which wasn't as nice and smaller but it was fine. The beds are very comfortable and the rooms are clean and quiet. The location of this hotel in the French Quarter is PERFECT. You are a stones throw away from Bourbon Street (if you're into that) and Canal Street/St Charles to catch the must-do streetcars. Around the hotel are great dining option and there a lot of lovely side streets to explore. Right around the corner on Conti Street is a bar called The Bombay Club which has some of the tastiest martinis I have ever had - definitely check it out! The service at the Chateau LeMoyne was incredible. Every one was super friendly and helpful and genuine about it too. We spent a lot of time at the lobby bar (it rained a lot so what else can you do there besides eat and drink?) and the bartender fellow was soooooo nice! There breakfast restaurant is cute and large but not cheap but good if you have to leave early and have no time to find other quaint spots in the Quarter. The hotel as a lovely courtyard with a heated pool that I never used (it was cold outside!!) but it looked great with the comfy loungers and plants. I highly recommend this hotel who want something cheap but cheerful and comfortable! Again, the location is great and should be the biggest factor in a decision. Thanks again to the wonderful staff and I will be back for sure :)

Reviews.Title: “Nice room, attentive staff, great experience”
Reviews.Author: William B
Reviews.Content: Boy did we need a nice place to stay after the poor hotels earlier on our trip. Bingo. We were given a nice room on the top floor with a lofted ceiling. I asked for a balcony room and they offered us a smoking room at the same price despite the normally higher cost (no non-smoking balcony rooms were available). We stayed with the top floor room since it was bigger and no smell. Parking was expensive at $35 so I shopped around and found that it was not expensive for the French Qtr. The staff was very helpful, the facility is clean and updated, was a very pleasant stay. The only complaint we had is that the restaurants they recommended were mediocre, not really a valid complaint.

Reviews.Title: “The good and bad”
Reviews.Author: Lyncar
Reviews.Content: First the positives - This hotel has a great location, the room was nice enough, and had a balcony on a side street. Noisy, but that was to be expected. The concierge (Alan, the hardest working man in NOLA) was fantastic. The negatives: 1 - The lack of in-hotel coffee after 10 in the morning is seriously annoying. Room and breakfast restaurant service ends by 10ish. When you're partying in NOLA, you're sleeping in. No coffee anywhere other than the seriously bad crap in your room. You have to walk a couple of blocks to find some. 2 - Our in-room safe did not work. 3 - We left at 8am one day and our room was still not cleaned by 2:30. YET... 4 - Requested a late check-out the day we were leaving and were denied (even though I'm a Platinum Priority Club member). Said we had to be out by 11 on the dot or we'd be charged another day. The rudeness in which we were treated was unacceptable. And, btw, at 11am, there was not a single cleaning crew on the floor to poised to clean the rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Could not ask for better”
Reviews.Author: Will B
Reviews.Content: Hotel is ideally located a block from Bourbon Street. Room was spacious, clean, and offered good views. Room rate was competitive. However, what made the stay there most enjoyable was the kindness and courteousness of the staff. From the bellman to the restaurant staff to the clerks, everyone was friendly and helpful. I don't ever remember a more pleasurable stay at any hotel anywhere in all my travels.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: yorkesgirl
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for one night in the beginning of December. It was a last minute weekend away and we hadn't made a booking before we arrived, but after doing a bit of research decided to try here because of it's price and location. As we were only staying one night and it was our first time to New Orleans we just needed somewhere to sleep and nothing fancy (or pricey) was required. We were able to get a room no dramas, but check in was slow. I would have marked service as average because of this but everyone else we came across in the hotel were fantastic. The room was quite large, we had a king room with a balcony. If you are booking online, don't expect to be able to go out on the balcony as they have bolted the windows. The view is of the carpark, but also you get to see some of the old, French Quarter buildings in the area and I quite liked it. Bathroom basic and a bit out dated but we didn't need anything more than what it was. I found the bed to be comfortable and the different types of pillow to choose from good. The location is great, close to Bourbon Steet but not close enough you can hear all the noise. It is a nice walk to get to Jackson Square and French Market. Concierge and valet staff were great. Note, expect to pay about $30 for valet parking but this seemed the average price for the area. We would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Clean”
Reviews.Author: rebingtx
Reviews.Content: My daughters and I spent 3 nights close to Bourbon Stree and room was very clean. Had a problem with one of our bags of itmes we bought missing however the motel took care of the problem and we were very happy. Would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “It's ok... would not stay here again”
Reviews.Author: RxTravels
Reviews.Content: The hotel has a great location one block off of Bourbon St. You do not get any of the noise from Bourbon St. The hotel has a nice lobby, and the concierges were always nice. The staff at the front desk was always unfriendly and not very helpful. Be sure everything is right with your booking before you get there, because they do not care. The rooms are okay. The pillows are small, square, and terrible to sleep on. Housekeeping always seemed to move our stuff around while cleaning which was very odd. There are several hotels in the French Quarter, and if we were going back we would not stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Clean enough room, overpriced.”
Reviews.Author: frequenttravellerMd
Reviews.Content: Rooms for the location were clean. Pillows were squares. Like sofa pillows rather than standard pillows. Be ware 2 bed rooms contain full size beds not queen size beds. I did not sleep well all week. Next time I will bring my own pillow and book a king size bed. Did find a roach in the tub, but that was it. There was no hot water at 5am..that was just once. Water had a sewage smell. Overall acceptable room. Just note the size of the pillow and bed. Also, they don't have a restaurant. They serve breakfast, but you have to pay and it is a la carte.

Reviews.Title: “Great place for the value”
Reviews.Author: DocnWitch
Reviews.Content: We were very satisfied with our stay here. Staff was friendly and attentive, the room very clean and well kept. Location was a big plus being 3 blocks from the convention hotels on Canal Street and 1 block from Bourbon. Would have liked to try the pool in the courtyard which looked very inviting. Even though it is a Holiday Inn, It is an older hotel so I would not consider it modern or luxurious, but it is comfortable. 2 suggestions to Management-please put an extra blanket in the closet for cool nights and get some real big pillows for the bed, not those things you have which we use as chair pillows at home. All considering, we enjoyed our stay here would return and recommend it to other travelers who are looking for clean comfortable lodging at a reasonable rate for the French Quarter

Reviews.Title: “Creole suites are charming, but hope for quiet neighbors”
Reviews.Author: NJ_Traveler05
Reviews.Content: My husband and I were upgraded to a Creole suite Thanksgiving weekend. It was absolutely charming with exposed brick walls, a wood beam ceiling in the sitting room and tasteful furnishings. The bathroom was quite small for a suite, but it was clean and up-to-date. The only downside is the lack of soundproofing. At one point I could hear not only our upstairs neighbor talking on the phone but also the person on the phone responding. It was particularly unpleasant when we had a (different) upstairs neighbor with a young child prone to wailing. Service was erratic. The concierge seemed clueless and was the least helpful I have ever met. The front desk staff, however, was very knowledgeable and gave us great recommendations on the area. The hotel, itself, is well located. It is far enough away from Bourbon St and the main tourist areas to avoid the noise, but was within walking distance of almost every where we wanted to go.

Reviews.Title: “Surprisingly quiet, just a block off Bourbon St.”
Reviews.Author: lifestylecoordinator
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a great bargain in terms of location and helpful staff. The hotel itself is clean and has moderate amenities. We really enjoyed the staff, they were helpful and friendly. The concierge went above and beyond, making this seem like a much higher-end hotel---he is exceptionally well versed in the local food scene, too. Definitely tap into that resource when you go. Getting around the French Quarter is a (Drew?) breeze from this location. Our room faced away from Bourbon Street and was very quiet and private feeling. I intend to return to this hotel on my next visit to NOLA.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet stay in the Quarter”
Reviews.Author: dawnya
Reviews.Content: The rooms are a step up from the average Holiday Inn, the staff is exceptional. There is a great pool area in the center courtyard, and the place is well kept overall. Valet parking is $35 which sounds pretty spendy, but the nearest garage is a block away and costs $25 a night and isn't as secure. You are 2 blocks from Bourbon Street and all the action, but still it is a quiet, safe place.

Reviews.Title: “Great Little Hotel with an Unbeatable Location in the Quarter”
Reviews.Author: Michael N
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Chateau Lemoyne this Fall for a relaxing weekend getaway. It is located in a great central location in the French Quarter. Rooms were nice, service was great, and the room rates are very reasonable. I will stay there again and recommend it to friends without question.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Experience”
Reviews.Author: AmyK102011
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Chateau LeMoyne this past weekend because in downtown New Orleans, Louisiana, and because my sister works at a Holiday Inn in Wisconsin and we were able to get a great rate.The hotel was very clean and the staff was helpful with directions and area suggestions, especially Crystal, the concierge, and the bellman who stored our luggage free of charge and arranged a cab for us on the last day so we could take in a few more sights before we headed to the airport. It was within a 10 minute walk of all the sights and right next to restaurants and Bourbon St. I would definitely recommend this hotel for future stays.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: jaymesnav
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very nice and the front desk was very helpful in getting us a rollaway bed in the King room we had for 2. The concierge on duty when we arrived late Saturday night (Oct 29, 2011) was not helpful at all. A traveling companion asked about vending machines and the gentleman said that there weren't any, we then saw them on the second floor. The staff was not very outgoing and the housekeepers woke us up too early (9:30am) even though we were a stayover not a due out. Still, it was a great location.

Reviews.Title: “Far enough away if you aren't the "Bourbon Street" type”
Reviews.Author: NJTTexas
Reviews.Content: Second time in New Orleans with a group reunion. Had a "banquet" room for meetings right outside one of the patios - very nice place to meet up with everyone. Seems that noone had a problem with rooms that I know of. We had a room that seemed to be on the "newer" side of the hotel and I would recommend requesting the "newer" side. Our friends who had a room on the "older" side commented that our room was more spacious and nicer. We faced the inner courtyard which was fine - was afraid it would be noisy, but it wasn't. The bathrooms were small but manageable. The breakfast was good (they have a coffee station for those who don't want to make it in the room which is nice). The service for breakfast was very slow - would have hated to see it when there were more people eating there. The hotel is close for walking to all the sights - it was nice to be close to Canal and the trolley.

Reviews.Title: “Close to Bourbon St.”
Reviews.Author: KnoxTrouter
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with my wife the first weekend in November. It's only a block or two to Bourbon Street... just far enough away to avoid most of the sounds of late night partying. The room was comfortable and clean but the bathroom is rather small. The price was lower than similar hotels closer to the "action" which we considered to be a better value since we spent very little time in the room. On the weekend most restaurants serving breakfast had a line so best to go a little early to avoid the wait. Nosh's was great for breakfast and just down the street.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Lemoyne”
Reviews.Author: jamusaba
Reviews.Content: My wife and i thoroughly enjoyed our 4 night stay at this excellently located French Quarter hotel. The room itself was a typical Holiday Inn double room except ours had a balcony which faced a not very trafficed street. You could see Bourbon street in the distance from the balcony but the hotel at least is conveniently far away from the noise except on Saturday night when a mock funeral procession jazz band passed below our balcony. Actually we rather enjoyed the spectacle. The hotel is in a 150 year old period building though it has been renovated in usual Holiday Inn fashion. The area abounds in excellent restaurants, old world charm, attractions and of course bars featuring live music. We recommend walking a bit beyond the French Quarter to the Faubourg Marigny area on Frenchman to find the less touristy jazz venues and more reasonably priced restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “Noisy ventilation system, but otherwise very nice.”
Reviews.Author: like2travel1
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent two nights here on the fourth floor overlooking the pool. Our room with a king-size bed was large and very comfortable, but the bathroom was very small. Everything was clean. The only problem we had was the sound of a very noisy, pulsating motor sound which appeared to be coming from the room adjoining the headboard of our bed, which kept me from quickly falling asleep. After the first night the front desk clerk offered to move us to another room, but that room was just as noisy. But our room was very quiet from outside noise. Other than this, the hotel is charming and very well located to everything in the old part of the city. All of the staff were very friendly and very helpful with information, directions and restaurant recommendations. Our room included a one-cup coffee maker along with packages of regular and decaffeinated coffee, but no mini-refrigerator or microwave. The wirelesss internet access from our room worked fine. Valet parking is the only parking available and is in a fenced, secure lot directly acrosss the street. The valet attendants had no objection to opening the gate so we could get some additional things from our car. This was our second stay at this hotel in recent years and would definitely stay again if we were sure we would get a quiet room.

Reviews.Title: “What a great find in my favorite city”
Reviews.Author: CypressCarlos
Reviews.Content: I lived in New Orleans for 3 years, but that was over 20 years ago. If you have ever lived in the big easy, you know that you can never leave it. Because of that, I return at least 4 times a year. Sometimes I stay with friends, but most of the time, I stay in Hotels. This last weekend, a friend whom I catch a yearly Saints game with booked our hotel at the Chateau Lemoyne. Because the price was so reasonable, I really was not expecting much. I was expecting a battered old hotel in a great location. Instead we found an incredibly cool hotel in very good shape in a fantastic location. You are literally one block away from Bourbon street, close enough to stumble thru the doors if the street has gotten the better of you, close to some of the best restaurants in the world, and close enough to Canal for a quick escape out of the quarter. The location is perfection, the beauty of the hotel a bonus, and the shape of the hotel a very pleasant surprise. If the good Lord gives me many more years to enjoy life, I will certainly visit this property again. I have it now on my list of top 3 for the city that I love.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, cute courtyard, fast elevators”
Reviews.Author: gulfshoresmissy
Reviews.Content: Very close to Bourbon Street and not a bad walk to the casino. There is a little breakfast place very close and a neighborhood bar with cheap specials and drinks a block the other way. There is a parking charge, a valet has to go get it from across the street in a fenced in area and you can't walk over there alone to retrieve items so unpack everything. The courtyard pool area is quaint and part of the building is historic there with a little plaque on the wall. One of the fountains out there had turtles sunning themselves. The banquet room has more character than most with a little back courtyard off it to expand area or a nice place to chill out if there are kids in the pool. Staff is very nice, they loaned us a w/c to take my dad on a tour of Bourbon Street.... sidewalks are very much in disrepair, so watch it if you attempt this. Would recommend this place

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location, Location!”
Reviews.Author: exnonsmoker
Reviews.Content: This is THE perfect location for a New Orlean's visit that includes Bourbon Street - and what New Orlean's trip doesn't include at least a peek at Bourbon Street? The hotel is one tiny block away from Bourbon Street so you can escape the noise, smell and crowds quickly and easily. You are also a block and a half from Canal (Streetcars) and the CBD. We walked to all our destinations during our stay and we are not what you would call fit. When you look at the maps of the French Quarter, the blocks are actually quite small so don't let an eight or 10 block walk deter you. The hotel was clean and updated. Our room was fine, the bathroom a bit on the small side though. The beds were amazingly comfortable. We had no fridge or microwave but the small one-cup-at-at-time coffee dispenser was adequate. The hotel dining room/room service is only available for Breakfast but turn left out the front door for half a block and head for Deva-vu. It's open 24 hours and has an amazing menu for a dark little corner bar. The food was good and prices reasonable. If you want a place a little brighter, turn right out of the hotel for a block and try Nosh. The menu was smaller and a little more pricey but if you don't like the dive bar atmosphere this will be a better choice. The small coutyard/pool area was very nice. It was a great place to have a drink and dangle those tired feet in the pool after a long day. Yes - you can go pretty much anywhere with a drink in hand as long as it is in a plastic cup. If you want to spend a bit of quiet time with a drink and sports, I recommend the hotel bar. On Sundays and Mondays, Darrell is behind the bar and worth getting to know as a Louisana native. He's a blast to have on hand during Saints games! All the staff we interacted with were polite and effecient. Checkout is 11 am but we still had a couple of hours before we had to leave so they were able to lock up our luggage while we walked around and have a cab waiting for us when we returned. Very nice. If you are hoping for a full service spa experience, this is not the place. If you want a place to hang your clothes, take a shower and sleep away from the wafting Bourbon Street odors, you've found it.

Reviews.Title: “A great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: travelqueenorking
Reviews.Content: We were put in this hotel due to the fact that their sister hotel was having issues and they placed us in this one....It was wonderful...Loved it..

Reviews.Title: “An Excellent Stay”
Reviews.Author: Huberm
Reviews.Content: This is a charming hotel located right next to the heart of the French Quarter (Bourbon Street). Rooms are great - especially the ones with balconys which open to the street or pool area. I will definately stay here the next time I'm in town.

Reviews.Title: “Decent place.”
Reviews.Author: uder7272
Reviews.Content: Good hotel. Rooms were decent. We got a balcony room. No mini fridge to chill your drink while you hang out on the balcony. Ice machine was empty.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet and friendly”
Reviews.Author: fishmantas
