Reviews.Content: Lovely looking place with old world charm,helpfull staff with plenty of knowledge.Spent most of our time just walking around ,eating and soaking up the atmosphere.Room was clean.One walk up Bourbon Street was enough for us at night as to many young drunks!But off the main strip it was great.

Reviews.Title: “Blessed be the patient”
Reviews.Author: LJRoadWarrior
Reviews.Content: The hotel was nice...a little dated but not bad. The location was great for checking out the French Quarter. Crystal at the desk was awesome. She dealt patiently and quickly with several guests who had either never stayed in a hotel or never travelled to an actual city before. As an experienced traveller, their questions and demands struck me as a bit comical but she dealt with them with a smile. I commend her because she was THE ONLY person working the front desk all day that Saturday. She answered the phone and cleared a long line of customers (some who seemed to get quite upset when they finally made it to the front) all with a smile and managed to calm everyone down. She recognized me as a plat. member and gave me a GREAT upgrade. She answered my questions about the area and made sure our bags were safe while the room was being prepared (we arrived a little early). It helped make it a great couple of days!

Reviews.Title: “Great boutique hotel that is away from all the excitement but in walking distance”
Reviews.Author: islandsuga
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for the Essence festival in july2011. This was perfect! You were a couple blocks from Bourbon street but still secluded. This is a small boutique type hotel so if maintenance or any other assistance was needed, you were able to get assistance in a timely manner. The only down side was the bathroom was small, but we weren't in our hotel room a lot to complain about the size. Great hotel to stay in French Quarter. Don't have to deal with the "crazies" and the smell of bourbon street like the other holiday inn that is located in the heart of French Quarter

Reviews.Title: “Terrific Hotel on a Quiet Street in the French Quarter”
Reviews.Author: Sinead5
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Chateau Lemoyne for five nights in Room 449 overlooking the courtyard with the swimming pool. The room had a very comfortable king-sized bed, as requested and was much larger than an average hotel room. The pool area is lovely and the pool itself was very clean. It was nice to return to the hotel for a quick dip before going out at night. The staff were very accommodating, friendly and helpful. In terms of location, the hotel is in the north west corner of the French Quarter. We spent a lot of time on Frenchmen Street which is a good 20 minute walk away, so next time I might pick a hotel that is closer to that location. However, having said that, the walk did provide an excuse to continually try different routes through the Quarter... All in all, it is an excellent hotel and very good value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Economical stay in the French Quarter”
Reviews.Author: MrFix3
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for three nights with my wife and two daughters (21 and 18). We booked two rooms, my daughters had a balcony room overlooking Rue Dauphine with two double beds and my wife and I had a room with a queen size bed overlooking a wall. Both rooms were nicely furnished, a bit nicer than what you would expect from a Holiday Inn. The bathrooms were very small, the door nearly hits the toilet when open. The location was perfect, a block away from Bourbon Street (and the noise and smell) but close to several excellent restaurants (GW Fin, Arnauds, Louisiana Bistro). There was a lovely salt water swimming pool in the courtyard of the hotel, and the staff was helpful and courteous. I'd give them 5 stars except they had some sort of mixup with our payment and actually disabled our keys temporarily. A visit to the desk straightened thongs out, but there was no apology or explanation other than "Sometimes cell phones cause the keys to not function".

Reviews.Title: “going back!!!”
Reviews.Author: rollingrock39
Reviews.Content: Alan and Roy are 2 of the hotel's greatest employee's. They we're so helpful and kind and patient! Gave us the best advise on tours as well as where to eat and shop. The hotel is very clean and comfortable, and perfectly placed in the quarter( Walking distance 2 blocks from canal st and 1 block off bourban). Safes in all rooms for free!!! Ask Alan to set you up for the airboat adventure tours, a must do while you are there!!!!

Reviews.Title: “A great French Quarter find.”
Reviews.Author: W55Louisiana
Reviews.Content: I chose this hotel due to reviews on tripadvisor and I am so happy I stayed here. What a delightful boutique hotel. Staff was gracious, rooms were spacious, inner courtyard was lovely. We stayed in a corner room where we had 3 private balconies. Bed was very comfortable. I would definitely stay here again. No reason to pay 200+ for a room when this one is just as nice as the more expensive hotels in the French Quarter. You are in the Quarter and not far from Bourbon St so don't expect the weekend nights to be quiet until about 2 am.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay for the Junior Olympics”
Reviews.Author: mi3sonz
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 3 nights with our 12 year old for the Junior Olympics Track and Field. The hotel was a very nice place to stay for location, price and atmosphere - in that order......; our room was clean and the pool area was nice. You may have some noise depending upon what is going on in the halls or alleys at the wee hours; but I'm sure that is common anywhere near Bourbon street. For a FAMILY - I would skip Bourbon and walk on down to the Market area and Jackson Square..... We had a lot of fun!!! Pralines, ACME Oyster House, Biegnets and coffee, shops, live music, street performers, Good local cigars, great drinks, street cars, Lots of fun... Taxis are the best way to get around longer distances (i.e. the airport), while most of everything is really just a short walk from this hotel.......

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, good price, late check in”
Reviews.Author: smahan6
Reviews.Content: This hotel was great. It was a few steps away from bourbon st without all the noise. The only dislike was the check in time. Its 4pm, we got into LA at 7am and we couldnt get into our room until 230ish. Other then that, everyone was really friendly and the pool are was nice.

Reviews.Title: “Unparalled service - great location”
Reviews.Author: Leatrice_O'Neill
Reviews.Content: The Chateau Lemoyne is a Holiday Inn property. As such, it is not what one would call a luxury hotel. Yet it was still very, very nice, has a good outdoor pool and provided smoking rooms for the smokers among us. What makes this hotel a standout is the wonderful level of service their staff provides - it far exceeded that of the more luxurious hotel we've stayed in. Never once did I have to call housekeeping to ask about my room being cleaned. All requests to housekeeping (more hangers and such) were rsponded to within 5 minutes. The lobby/front desk staff were always welcoming and helpful (offereing an umbrella when it was raining). One felt very cared for. Located just one block off Bourbon in the French Quarter, the location is excellent - nearby great restaurants, inexpensive breakfast places, Walgreens and any shop you can imagine. I was told by another guest that the room service breakfasts are great and arrive very quickly after the order has been placed. We will defiitely be returning. And their rates can't be beat.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice and in the Quarter!!”
Reviews.Author: in4ed
Reviews.Content: Arrived early and they parked my car for $38.00, but got a real room deal on Priceline. They kept my bags under lock so I was free to walk the Big Easy until the room was ready. The hotel was spotless, they honored my 'courtyard view' request as well. No fridge or microwave, but who eats 'in' when in NOLA? Nice deep pool in courtyard! Beds slept well with lots of pillows- really a GREAT hotel room to be one block off Bourbon Street, and so quiet! The staff were excellent, and I will DEFINITELY stay again.

Reviews.Title: “WHAT A DISAPPOINTMENT”
Reviews.Author: Bunwim
Reviews.Content: So very disappointed in this place. We asked for a quiet room, or as quiet as you can get near the French Quarter, and we were put on the second floor next to the side street. Little did we know that that has got to be the LOUDEST area there is. Dumpster trucks emptying garbage at three in the morning every single night we were there. Having to SHARE a balcony with absolute strangers who were obnoxiously shrewd. If your neighbors smoke in their room, you better believe your room is going to get the smoke too. One person working the breakfast shift. Don't bother waiting (you'll even be encouraged to go somewhere else) because breakfast won't be happening for you until maybe noon. Even though we had coupons to eat free, it just wasn't worth the hassle to deal with it. So as I lay here in this room which will barely cool, having to again listen to thy neighbors and inhale their smoke, hearing all the dumpsters being emptied, and wondering if the breakfast shift will be more than a single person wading through crying hungry kids, I again kick myself for being here. And don't think for a second I haven't begged and pleaded for another room ... but, hey, burgers at Yo Mama's were great!!! Gotta post a positive in here somewhere ...

Reviews.Title: “Interesting Architecture”
Reviews.Author: cdurbin
Reviews.Content: We stayed 2 nights at the Chateau Lemoyne, just a couple of blocks off of Bourbon street. The hotel was nice and one of the staff members gave us a short history of the bulding(s) - very neat. We stayed in a "suite" which used to be slave quarters. Don't expect brand new everything here - a couple of the buildings are hundred years old - but very well kept. The pool courtyard was very nice and quiet. Big tip here - parking is $39 a night but the valet told me there was cheaper parking up the street . He suggested one that was $24. I went to three and found one just two blocks north and one block west of the hotel for $15 per night. Look for the big parking arrow on Rampart Street.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location for a French Quarter vacation”
Reviews.Author: DaLaR1
Reviews.Content: My wife and I have stayed here twice and will never stay anywhere elsw in New Orleans. It is a quiet, classy place with nice rooms and a location in walking distance to anything worth doing. It is far enough away from the hustle and bustle to be a quiet respite, but a couple minutes on foot will get you where you need to be.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable stay”
Reviews.Author: milehighatlanta
Reviews.Content: The main reason we picked this hotel is that it had an outdoor pool. The beds were very comfortable. The location is very convenient to all the French Quarter activities. We would definitely stay here again....

Reviews.Title: “Loved our stay here!”
Reviews.Author: Glendathegoodwitch
Reviews.Content: Bad beginning that had a marvelous ending. We reserved one of the creole king suites. Shortly after arriving in our room the front desk called to check and make sure everything was suitable. As it turns the AC unit in the living room was not working. Long story short, they had to move us even though the unit started working a few minutes. We were the 2nd to have a problem with the AC. There were no more creole suites available and I was really disappointed, but I was told the move would be an upgrade. Turns out they moved us to the most amazing suite on the second floor. It was lovely and HUGE, with a large private balcony. Staff went out of their way to make things right! Everyone was pleasant and very helpful with everything. Housekeeping was very good. Didn't eat at the restaurant - so can't comment on the food. The location was perfect. Definitely recommend this spot.

Reviews.Title: “A Tranquil Respite minutes away from Busy Bourbon St.”
Reviews.Author: bananafish711
Reviews.Content: Our room was clean, well-lit and comfortable. Those we traveled with had nice rooms as well. Some rooms featured balconies, which we had the pleasure of enjoying during our stay. The hotel courtyard and pool were both lovely. Full of lush foliage and lined with tables and chairs; a perfect place to sit and enjoy a morning coffee. Hotel staff was friendly, warm and helpful. We would definitely return!

Reviews.Title: “Peaceful spot in the French Quarter”
Reviews.Author: floridalibn
Reviews.Content: Despite being only a block from Bourbon St., this hotel is quiet and peaceful. The courtyard with a little pool and loungers with towels is a blissful oasis of green amid the busy city. I really have no complaints about this hotel-- I stayed for four nights for a conference. My room was HUGE. The free wireless worked well. Decor was normal, but the rooms were clean, and the heat/cooling actually worked. Staff was accommodating and pleasant.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: GoodOneDollarBay
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Chateau Lemoyne May 9-14, 2011 and would stay again. Great staff, location, pool and the rooms are so quiet! We didn't hear anything at all. The lobby, bar and courtyad is very nice. Our room was clean and roomy. Who really cares about the view? You're not in NOLA to sit in the room! We would stay again! You don't need a car, you can walk to the French Market or take the trolley.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel in a great location.”
Reviews.Author: jerseytraveller_8
Reviews.Content: My wife and I just returned today from a 4 night stay at the Holiday Inn. Room: The first room we were given had an issue with the air conditioner so the following evening we requested and were given another room where the air worked great. The bed however in the first room was more comfortable. We didn't use the pool so I can't comment although it did look nice in the courtyard. The hotel did have a restaurant but with all the great food around us, we didn't eat in. Requests for a mini fridge is on a first come first serve basis and we were able to take advantage of that. The hotel is one block from Bourbon in the quarter but was far enough away from the noise. This was our fourth time to New Orleans and we move around to different hotels so we wouldn't stay again although the hotel was fine for what we were looking for.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: winebert
Reviews.Content: We stayed here May 12 thru 16. On our 1st night we went to the hotel bar and got the best Sazrac we had the whole trip, great job. The bar was a nice break from the noise and crowd on Bourbon. We will stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly surprised.”
Reviews.Author: FABackpacker
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel via Hotwire.ca. When I read the last few reviews, I got a bit nervous. And then I got to the hotel. It's a lovely hotel. Located one block North of Bourbon Street -- close enough that you're right there, far enough that you can't hear the partying. It's also two blocks East of Canal Street -- a major artery. Depending what direction your room faces, you can see the French Quarter rooftops pepper the horizon like you were in Europe (ok, a bit far fetched, but it looked European from the rooftops). There is a lovely courtyard with a heated pool. No, I didn't test out the pool, and wondered where all the people in the pool area found the time to lounge while in New Orleans. But it is beautifully landscaped. The pool is 6' deep at its deepest. The staff really are amazing ...like most people in New Orleans. Chatty. Kind. Helpful. Not sure where the Concierge was at all times, but the desk staff was always there to answer questions and make suggestions. The hotel parking is $38 for the night and valet. There are $16 parking options nearby, if necessary. Free internet in your room. Major plus! No recycling. The room was clean. I've never seen a bed made so tight. No bedbugs to report; the mattress was in a plastic covering. You couldn't tell it was in plastic unless you looked. I'm not a big fan of the Holiday Inn brand. The hotels are usually tacky. This one could have passed for a low-line Marriott. Not sure what the previous reviewer meant about the elevators. They were soft-renoed recently. For the price I paid, this was a steal!

Reviews.Title: “what a beautiful hotel, clean, friendly and comfortable”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an OctopusTravel traveler
Reviews.Content: This hotel has it all. The staff are very friendly, its exceptionally clean. The pool and courtyard are a great bonus. It is within a 5 minute walk of Bourbon St, and a 3 minute walk for the Canal St Street cars, excellent value for money. Will definitely stay here again when in New Orleans. Only thing I didnt like was having to pay for the internet to print my boarding passes. Why? when you have free internet in your rooms, why do you have to pay to print your boarding passes?

Reviews.Title: “Solid hotel in a solid location”
Reviews.Author: briantoronto
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for two nights at the start of JazzFest for a pretty amazing rate. My room was overlooking a small back courtyard: very quiet. The location is very good. On the edge of the French Quarter. A block away from the Charles Ave Streetcar as well. Rooms were basic refreshed Holiday Inn, so not bad at all. Only caviet is parking. $40 a night valet. If you don't plan to use your vehicle during your stay, there are other cheaper self park options nearby.

Reviews.Title: “Adorable Hotel. Just What We Were Looking For!”
Reviews.Author: sdb2385
Reviews.Content: No complaints about this hotel. The staff was friendly and helpful. The location is perfect. Walking distance from everything. Would highly recommend this hotel to anyone. We didn't ever wake up early enough to check out th breakfast but we did enjoy laying by the pool in the courtyard area, drinking shirley temples from the hotel bar, etc. This isn't your typical Holiday Inn. The building is old and has a lot of charm.

Reviews.Title: “Very Good Hotel with Great Service”
Reviews.Author: CashHokie
Reviews.Content: We were very pleased with our stay at this hotel in the French Quarter. It's a little on the edge of the Quarter but a short distance to Bourbon Street and the CBD. Our first day there I called down twice, once for more clothes hangers and once because the toilet was leaking. Both were taken care of very quickly. In the early morning, the people staying next to us decided to take our chairs on the balcony (it's connecting) and scrape them over to their side at 3 am, waking us up. We waited it out a bit to see if they would quiet down (which they didn't) so we called the front desk to ask them to call and tell them to keep the noise down. They did this right away and we didn't have problems with the neighboring room again. There was a bit of street noise in our room but that is everywhere in the French Quarter. The room was cleaned very well each day and the cleaning staff were always polite and cheerful. We loved the pool--it was a great place to relax. The bartender is excellent and the prices are very reasonable in comparison to most of the places in the Quarter. I would say the only exception to the rule of great service here was the day concierge. He was a little odd and his advice wasn't very good. He wasn't rude, just not very helpful. All in all, this is a great choice and a great value. I don't think you can go wrong staying here.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay. Loved the location and the staff”
Reviews.Author: coachdog1
Reviews.Content: Stayed over the Easter weekend and enjoyed every minute of the stay. Crystal started the stay off in a great way. She was such a pleasure to deal with. She has such a great personality and treats you like she really cares and wants you to enjoy your stay. Had a balcony room and the Bienville side side of the hotel. The room was spacious and clean. There was some street noise but nothing too bad. Bathroom was clean but a little small. Again nothing that really detracted from enjoying the stay. Housekeeping did a fine job. Free wireless which worked well for us throughout the entire stay. Did not visit the pool area, but it seemed to be very popular as it was always busy. Also did not visit the restaurant that is located in the hotel. There are so many places nearby that we just never had reason to eat there. I think the restaurant is only open for breakfast. There is a lounge also, but did not visit that either. Love the location. We were able to walk everywhere we wanted to go. Would not hesitate to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Service above and beyond...”
Reviews.Author: Gerry059
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Chateau Lemoyne for 4 days. The service, in all respects, was impeccable. From the front desk to the concierge to the making up of the room, our every need was met. The staff is friendly, knowledgeable, and, this is a plus, funny. That's good. When we checked out, our route out of the Quarter was blocked everywhere by a marathon. When we returned to the hotel to ask for help, Jeffrey and Todd did everything except remove the saw horses to help us get to the airport. The next time we're in New Orleans we will absolutely book the Chateau Lemoyne.

Reviews.Title: “Chateau Le Moyne”
Reviews.Author: sunluvr
Reviews.Content: My husband and I were invited along on a short vacation with three other couples, this being the first trip to New Orleans for most of us. One of the couples did all the research (a lot of which I know was done on this site). They were spot on with this choice! The location is excellent. Only one block off of Bourbon Street and a few blocks up to Canal, we were close to everything yet did not have to experience any of the noise when we settled in each evening. This hotel does have its own restaurant but we never did eat here so I cannot comment on it. It appeared to be enjoyed by many. The drinks in the bar were good as was the service. Front desk here is exceptional, Crystal is the best! Housekeeping did a great job. The concierge was very helpful when we had questions or wanted to book some excursions. The pool is a great plus. We spent some time lounging there when we wanted to enjoy a quiet atmosphere when we weren't out exploring everything there is to offer on the streets of New Orleans. If I ever plan another trip to New Orleans I would definitely stay here again. I can't think of a better location!

Reviews.Title: “Crystal and Alan”
Reviews.Author: GreatGrandCB
Reviews.Content: They were great!!! They made my husband and I trip one to remember. We have been on many vacations in our thirty years of marriage but this was the best one yet. it was our first time to the city in twenty years. The hotel was nice. The location is near everything yet nice and quite. Housekeeping was good but throw away our special cups. Some lady was at the bar really loud. Eddie still attended to us like we were the only ones in the bar. CRYSTAL AND ALAN!!(the reason why we will be back.) Crystal checked us in and was light of our trip. We made it a point to see her everyday. Alan was our bellman and he was so knowledgeable about the hotel and its history, which is very interesting. I will recommend this hotel to anyone looking for a real taste of New Orleans.

Reviews.Title: “Best Bachelor Party Ever”
Reviews.Author: bklyn11217
Reviews.Content: Last spring I went down to NOLA with 15 other guys for my Bachelor Party/Jazz Fest. We booked 4 double/double rooms for 4 nights. All the rooms were booked under the same name and earned enough Holiday Inn points to earn a free weekend just about anywhere. I arrived with 4 other guys in the early afternoon. Our rooms weren't ready yet but were told that our friends were already partying at the pool. We went out to the pool and found 3 more friends and a case of beer waiting for us. After about 2 hours and at least 2 more cases of beer, we were checked into our rooms. The rooms were very large, one them was upgraded to a courtyard suite. Awesome... By now about 10 people had arrived so we decided to hit the town. The hotel was one block from Bourbon St, which made it very easy to stumble/crawl back to the hotel at dawn each morning for the next four nights. We had 4 nights of drunken debauchery, great food, awesome music, gambling, laughter, and so much more...If you can't have fun in New Orleans there is something seriously wrong with you. I can't wait to go back

Reviews.Title: “Great location- just what we were looking for”
Reviews.Author: magsvanlind
Reviews.Content: Located in the heart of the French quarter, just a block off Bourbon St., this property was perfect for our first visit to New Orleans . It is an old building, but what do you expect in the French Quarter? Rooms were large, clean and comfortable. Bathrooms were small, but again, in an old building they generally are. Front desk, concierge and bell staff were terrific. Bartender, Eddie, however was very cold and rude. Not welcoming at all. Pool area could use a little attention,Area was quite messy at 6:00 in the afternoon. The restaurant is only open for breakfast. Which cancels any thought of an appetizer over a glass of wine before heading out for the night. We walked EVERYWHERE from this location. Jackson Square, the Aquarium, ect. Also just a 2 block walk to the street car if you don't want to walk to the sights. Overall, a great spot!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, great service, perfect location, great price”
Reviews.Author: mdjones1125
Reviews.Content: Our first time to New Orleans and had a great 6 night stay at the Chateau. We would like to give big props to Tamica at the front desk. Our flight from Cleveland arrived very early in the morning and the hotel had been sold out the night before. So, we waited what seemed like an eternity for 4:00pm to arrive so that we could check in. At 4:00 there were still no rooms available. Tamica took pity on us waiting so long and gave us a room upgrade! the room was outstanding and we throughly enjoyed our stay. Also, we had a problem with one of the tours we took(VIP tours). Basically, they over sold the tour van and since we were the last to get on, VIP shoved us into the last row and this make it a very uncomfortable two hour tour of the city. Jeff, the tour scheduler at the hotel very much agreed with us and got some of our money back. Both Jeff and Tamica went the extra mile for us. That's what really helps to make a great vacation. The hotel itself is very nice. Clean and well kept. The pool in the court yard is a nice touch and, coming from the cold weather in the north, we spent some time just sitting in the court yard to relax and think what June will feel like in Cleveland. The hotel is the perfect distance from Bourbon street and all the action. The street is for Adults and I am clueless how folks can have their kids walking around down there esp. in the evening and I am about as far away from a prude as you can get. It was great to go from bar to bar and band to band and keep your drink in your hand. The steamboat tour on the Mississippi is worth the money esp. in the evening. We ate a great, resonably priced dinner at the Bourbon street restaurant. All in all, great trip. We booked the Chateau 4 months in advanced and I feel we got a great rate.

Reviews.Title: “Decent place, good location, rude desk clerk.”
Reviews.Author: Wyomingdigger
Reviews.Content: Watch for Roy. We had problems with a room transfer- first clerk was suppose to leave a note but apparently didn't. Roy let us know that this was "not his problem" as we were locked out of our room and could not get to our stuff.

Reviews.Title: “Love the Charm and Location!!”
Reviews.Author: Bula12
Reviews.Content: I must say, I love the charm of this hotel and the location!! Right off of Bourbon Street on a nice quiet corner. You can relax and still close to the action .. Love this hotel.. Would stay here everytime we go to N.O.

Reviews.Title: “I needed Noahs ARk!”
Reviews.Author: rennaissance
Reviews.Content: The room they gave me was lousy and badly needed repairs. The pliumbing flooded for 2 days. No hot water. This is no way to treat an old lady. Location is the ONLY advantage of this hotel - so, perhaps they have neglected repairs and maintenance.

Reviews.Title: “Gives Holiday Inn a Questionable Reputation”
Reviews.Author: Mema59
Reviews.Content: I made this reservation months in advance, called two days before to confirm and everything seemed fine. At check-in as a Priority Club member, we were told that because our credit card did not "take" the reservation, we would have to pay full price for the room. In addition to the surprise parking fees, we were preparing to leave, when the manager appeared and embarassed us by loudly proclaiming that our credit card was denied. There was no way this was possible, and unfortunately we had not brought that particular card with us. Upon returning home, I checked the card number they used and there was absolutely nothing wrong with the card number, however, they did put in the wrong expiration date, thus their error. They did go ahead and give us the "pay in advance" prices, but when we got the room, there was water in the tub and no signs of the room being cleaned recently. They moved us to another room which was smaller, had a tiny dresser, off brand TV, and a terrivle view. At the same time we were checking in, two ladies were at the front desk complaining of plumbing problems, also. On the plus side, the bar was reasonably priced (probably the best drinks and prices in New Orleans), the bartender very friendly as were the valets and the maintenance person, They seemed to know where to eat and gave impecable directions. The beds are awesomely comfortable and room was quiet. The last night of our stay, the same manager found us in the bar and personally apologized for the check-in fiasco. He was pleasant and sincere, offered a complimentary drink. Additional information; there is no frig or microwave and very little closet space. Limited drawer space also. This is an isolated unfavorable review of the Holiday Inn Express for us. We love the chain, but will not stay in the New Orleans site again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, little noisy”
Reviews.Author: davismMontreal
Reviews.Content: This was the second trip for my wife and I to Nola, and it's hard to have a bad time there. Chateau Lemoyne was great, service was excellent, room was a good size and clean, bed comfy, and the location was unbeatable. A couple of minor down points. You could hear pretty much everything in the halls. This was not a big problem for the most part, but there were 2 out of our 4 nights there where people were roaming the halls at night, and we could hear absoutely everything. I don't know if the doors are too thin or what, but it might be a bit rough if you're a light sleeper. The heating system is also pretty noisy, it really lets you know when it's turning on and off. You get used to it, but it might annoy you on your first night. The shower also had a bit of a drainage issue. If your shower went longer than 3 minutes, you had yourself up to your ankles in water. All in all no big complaints, certainly nothing that ruined our stay. I'd stay again. Besides, with all the great, food, music, sights, and nightlife, who goes to Nola to sit in their room?

Reviews.Title: “The service was amazing at this hotel.”
Reviews.Author: TammyJ033
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Chateau LeMoyne for our girls weekend in New Orleans. The staff was professional and courteous. Just amazing. The rooms weren't fantastic, but let's face it, I didn't go to New Orleans to have a fancy hotel room. They were very clean and the beds were comfortable and that's all I need. I highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Find another hotel”
Reviews.Author: Serku
Reviews.Content: Don't stay at this hotel. The guy at the front desk was very rude. He gave us a smoking room even though we requested a non smoking room and the room was dirty, dingy and smelled awful. When we requested to be moved to another room he didn't even bother to check if there was a room available, he just said no and proceeded to talking to one of the other staff members. The pool area wasn't that much better either. It's very small and there were about 20 people packed in there. This hotel looked worse than a cheap motel. Don't waste your money here,find another hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A really really pleasant surprise”
Reviews.Author: thecrankytraveller
Reviews.Content: We agonised over booking this hotel due to some of the reviews on tripadvisor. In the end we went with it because of the location and the fact that it is an older traditional style of hotel for the area. We were travelling with a 13 year old so needed to ensure the place we stayed was safe and friendly. Immediately upon check in we knew we had made the right decision. From the valet guy to the concierge and check in staff everybody could not have been any nicer or more helpful. As depicted on other reviews the hotel is old, not in perfect upkeep but definitely clean and well looked after considering. Rooms are small, the plumbing all works but isnâ€™t state of the art. We found that noise from other rooms and the hall were higher than in other hotels but not to the point that it disrupted sleep or our enjoyment. The beds are soft (I like them firm but you canâ€™t satisfy everyone). The linen etc was in good condition and clean. The lifts are slow so add an extra few minutes when needed. The car parking is expensive $37.50 a day for a car (there is no self park) but the room rate was good so it all averages out. Now location is king in the French quarter and this works out fine, one block to Bourbon street a short stroll to the square or canal street and a myriad of great eating places are also within a short distance. If you are looking for a 5 star resort or a chain hotel feel this isnâ€™t for you. Itâ€™s unique rough around the edges but so very New Orleans. Itâ€™s safe and as stated above so very well located.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Hotel in Excellent Location”
Reviews.Author: annikalibby
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel during two weeks away on business that involved five cities and five different hotels. This hotel was great, easily one of the better for this particular star rating. The room was spotless, the bed was comfortable, an assortment of soft and firm pillows was available, and there were both a safe and a coffee maker in the room. Staff were very polite and prompt, and I was allowed to check in at 1pm despite "official" check in starting at 5pm. There was absolutely zero noise from the street, and the location was fabulous--close to everything: Bourbon Street, St. Louis Cathedral and Jackson Square, Aquarium, Canal street, etc. Only two possible complications that I can think of: 1.) parking is valet only at $38 per night (yikes!) and 2.) the walls are paper thin (as in, you will hear word for word your neighbors conversations, drunken entrance at 2am, and...er, any other noises they make while occupying a hotel room together). I lucked out and had silent neighbors the second night, not so much the first night.

Reviews.Title: “A very pleasant stay!”
Reviews.Author: ShelbyLynn75
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Chateau Lemoyne Dec. 26-Dec. 30 2010. We have two boys, ages 9 and 15. I booked the hotel through a special advanced purchase price, and chose the option that included a balcony room facing Bienville. We arrived three hours prior to the 4:00 PM check-in time, but had zero issues checking in early. My husband was gone a mere five minutes before returning with a luggage cart. The valet promptly helped us unload our car and helped us to the elevator. We were not disappointed when we entered our room. We did indeed have a balcony in a room with two double beds, a table and chairs (pluse a table and two chairs on the balcony), flat panel TV, very large closet complete with safe and full size ironing board and iron. There was plenty of room for all of our luggage with lots of room to spare, and we didn't travel lightly. The bathroom was about average size, not huge, but not too small either. We had plenty of room to spread out all of our toiletries. The showerhead was very large, and the water pressure was great. The tub was a bit slow to drain, but it really wasn't an issue. I took very long showers during our stay and the water that accumulated in the tub during the shower never covered my feet. It wasn't a big deal at all. The beds were pretty comfortable, and while I did wish they were queen beds, we did absolutely fine with the doubles, even with my husband being a larger guy. The staff was very pleasant. The valet was always getting the door for us if he wasn't busy with cars. The front desk staff and the concierge were very nice and helpful. One night our kids were a bit bored after an early dinner, and they really went out of their way to offer suggestions and look for information. The cleaning staff was great, always smiling at us. They always left our room very clean. Every time we went to our room to get ready for dinner it smelled fresh, everything was clean, the powdered sugar all over the floor from our nightly beignets vacuumed, loads of fresh towels in the bathroom, coffee and cups restocked, etc. Even with a balcony room facing the corner of Dauphine and Bienville and being able to see Boubon from our balcony, the minute we closed our balcony door, the noise was virtually blocked out. We didn't notice much noice when we closed the balcony doors. The heated pool is a great plus if you have kids. Even though it was 40 degrees one evening, the pool was nice and warm, providing the kids with something fun to do at night. My husband and I even took a dip with them. The location is fantastic. It is literally one block from Bourbon St. and just a couple of blocks to Acme Oyster House, Oceana, Cafe Beignet, Nosh, Felix's. It's not a far walk at all to Jackson Square, the French Market, and everything else on Decatur. It's two blocks from Canal as well. We walked back to the hotel from the WWII Museum, and thoroughly enjoyed the walk. I can't say enough about how great the location is. I would definitely recommend the Chateau Lemoyne. I am booking the hotel again for a trip in Feb.

Reviews.Title: “Do not stay here!”
Reviews.Author: never_again_nola
Reviews.Content: I've stayed in many hotels and travel often. This is the most unfriendly hotel I've ever stayed in. Mostly upper level. Never AGAIN! I would not suggest ever staying here.

Reviews.Title: “Don't take balcony room on street”
Reviews.Author: F00die2010
Reviews.Content: Paid extra - yikes - New Orleans never sleeps and neither will you

Reviews.Title: “If you want a better hotel one block to Bourbon Street, forget it.”
Reviews.Author: TravelBeaucoup
Reviews.Content: One block from Bourbon Street, but no noise or revelers outside the hotel. Good WiFi, included in the price. Restaurant only open for Breakfast, which is a la carte, but not expensive. I think the coffee is free. There is also a Coffee maker in the room. ESPN /ESPN2 on TV, but no FSC. Rooms were good, well presented. Valet parking. I did not see a parking lot. Pleasant stay. Excellent location. One small hiccup with our bill/credit card, but sorted out by the duty manager with no problem. This is the second time we've stayed here. I have no hesitation in recommending it again.

Reviews.Title: “Shouldn't be a Holiday Inn”
Reviews.Author: goodie2shoes1
Reviews.Content: This is my third stay at this particular hotel I am a member of the Holiday Inn Prority Club and used some points to pay for this room. I have to say it there is a great improvement in the housekeeping of the room since April of 2005. What hasn't changed is the lack of friendliness and coorporation of the front desk staff. It is apparent that the front desk staff thinks they can be rude and you will just come back anyway. There are hundreds of hotel in the New Orleans area so don't waste your money at this one.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel and Staff”
Reviews.Author: ExperiencedTraveler0
Reviews.Content: We just returned from New Orleans yesterday. I am platinum level in Priority Club and we were able to to be upgraded to suites. They were full Saturday and we had to switch rooms from the suite we were in - which was lovely. I thought we were going to have to go into a small queen bed room but to our surprise they put us in the Executive suite. That room was great! It has big flat screens in the main room, which is huge, and in the jacuzzi room - that's what I call a sweet suite. Every room is unique in the hotel. The location is perfect, a block from Bourbon, but no noise at all, walking distance to everything. The staff is wonderful! Everyone was very helpful and helped make our stay a pleasure. I especially want to single out Crystal at the front desk who was just a cheerful delight.

Reviews.Title: “Close enough to Bourbon Street â€“ Holiday Inn New Orleans - Chateau Lemoyne”
Reviews.Author: TripAdviser01
Reviews.Content: Great location to all the nightlife but quiet at night when you want to sleep. Small pool area so you can relax in the morning before tackling the day in New Orleons. Had a great ride on a horse and carriage (with Willie), he was very friendly and took us to exactly where we wanted to go to. The music on the street was fantastic, loved all of it. Not to keen on Saturday night on Bourbon Street but go to Frenchman Road (where the locals go) for some really great music and the price of the drinks are very reasonable. Enjoy New Orleons, we did and we will return to both the Hotel and the City.

Reviews.Title: “The Good Times Rolled! Chateau Le Moyne - Holiday Inn New Orleans”
Reviews.Author: BarbiJKM
Reviews.Content: The Good Times Rolled! Four Days at Chateau LeMoyne My husband and I decided to take a mid-week getaway to New Orleans, and stayed at the Chateau Le Moyne for 3 nights in early November. I am a Priority Club member who often stays at Holiday Inns, and this was by far the NICEST Holiday Inn property I have ever stayed at! From the moment we arrived, we were impressed by the looks of the outside of the property, the amazing location, and the pool and garden areas. We were fortunate enough to meet Crystal, the receptionist at the front desk, at check-in. She was amazing â€“ pleasant, helpful, and smiling every time we saw her. She quickly found us a room with a Juliet balcony, facing the courtyard so we did not experience any street noise, and provided us with drink coupons for the bar. Over the next few days, she provided helpful and friendly suggestions about where to go and what to see, and answered our tourist questions with a smile. This girl deserves a raise! Itâ€™s so pleasant to be helped by an employee who clearly enjoys assisting her guests! Our room was spacious and comfortable, and housekeeping provided us with a small refrigerator upon request (â€œfirst come, first servedâ€� is the policy) at no charge. Guests have the option of requesting housekeeping after 2 p.m., which is a nice touch. The beds were extremely comfortable, with a good assortment of soft and firm pillows, and the bathroom was immaculately clean. Smoking rooms are available, and are well-ventilated, with windows that open. The heating/cooling system (we used both A/C and heat while we were there, as the temps dropped about 40 degrees in two days) worked well, with no noise. The hotel is located about a block and a half off Bourbon St. â€“ close enough to walk but far enough away to limit the noise â€“ and also within easy walking distance to Canal St. and the shops, Harrahâ€™s, the Riverside Marketplace, and many many restaurants and shops. Several small grocery stores and drug stores were close by, and food and drink was never more than a few steps away. We thoroughly enjoyed our visit, and would definitely stay at Chateau Le Moyne again! A big thanks to Crystal, who added to the enjoyment of our stay with her contagious smile and excellent service!

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommend for the price”
Reviews.Author: dbattagl
Reviews.Content: We are from NY, this was our first time in NOLA to visit our son who was on a college work study program to build houses down there . There were 7 of us, 3 rooms (2 with balcony overlooking Bienville. Rooms were very clean and having the balcony was great, saw a wedding reception w/police escort march down the street on Sat nite, and there happend to be filming of a Nichols Cage movie right across the street at Arnaud's. The hotel is the best of old and new accommodations. You get the ambiance of a boutique hotel but the piece of mind of having the amenities of a well known quality hotel chain. All of the staff was very accommodating, especially getting us good cab service. The pool/courtyard is lovely and the bar is nice too. We didnt eat there, but why would you want to, there are sooo many other places to choose from. Best of all its in a great location. I cant compare it to other hotels but for star level and price , it was well worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel in the Quarter”
Reviews.Author: Jennifertravels71
Reviews.Content: I recently visited New Orleans and decided to stay in the French Quarter. I was skeptical at first since I had read about crime and the all night parties, but I read many reviews and picked the Chateau LeMoyne. I traveled with my mother and 2 co workers all of which loved our stay. The staff at the hotel attended to our every need and whim. The staff were so helpful in finding excursions and stores. Especially Crystal on the evening shift. We would make it a point to stop in and talk to her daily. She never once acted put out or too busy to help us. Eddie in the bar was also very nice and gave us many suggestions on things to do that were more "local" interest. The house keeping staff were very prompt if we needed an extra towel or more tissues. The rooms were also cleaned well. Our room was almost perfect with the only suggestion we had would be an extra dresser or bigger one as we had 4 travelers and 3 drawers. Other than that the view from our room was awesome we had French doors overlooking a Spanish courtyard and pool it was very beautiful. The bed "heaven" that is all I can say about the bed and I have a sleep number bed at home. My friends and coworker thanked me all week long for picking this hotel because it was located 1 block from Bourbon ST. and was close to Canal St. it is in a great location. We all would recomend this hotel again and when we go back we will be staying there.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location, Great Value”
Reviews.Author: Stephanie036
Reviews.Content: The staff was extremely helpful and friendly, especially Crystal at the front desk. Hotel is in the perfect location, close to Bourban Street, yet far enough away so you don't hear all the street noise. Loved the pool/courtyard area. Would definetely recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, nice pool, decent rooms”
Reviews.Author: Meredi5309
Reviews.Content: A perfectly fine hotel, nothing amazing, but nice pool area and GREAT location right in the French Quarter! Hotel staff were adequate, price was right.

Reviews.Title: “If you LOVE Bourbon Street......”
Reviews.Author: ChiquitaJ
Reviews.Content: Great location, one block from Bourbon Street. Skip the restaurant breakfast. Overpriced and not very good. Nice bar. Needs to open before 3pm We needed a later checkout because our flight didnt leave until 7pm. They gave us an extra hour until 1pm. Would have been nice to have stayed until 3.

Reviews.Title: “Look elsewhere”
Reviews.Author: gettinwestern
Reviews.Content: I would stay elswhere. If Roy is checking you in, expect it to be a 20 minute process, he really struggles with this simple task. When we checked in, our room was not available and we were given a smaller room, a postage stamp size room. We asked to be moved the following day and were moved to a larger room. We had more space but the room had many issues... the air conditioner would quit and need attention, the toilet was mounted crooked, the closet clothes rack was broken and hanging down, the bathroom tile was stained and cracked, the safe was non functional and the room had obviouslly been in a fire at some point and smelled of smoke. Linnens were never changed in 5 nights, vacuuming of carpet was not done and bathroom floor stains remained the entire time. Its hard to believe this is part of the IHG franchise. Internet service is free but slowwww and there is a fee if you want to access basic printing services. If you want a fitness center, you have to walk several blocks to the next Holiday Inn to use them.

Reviews.Title: “Not the roomiest hotel, not for families!”
Reviews.Author: heathermark28
Reviews.Content: This hotel may be good for young couples who aren't looking for a nice place to stay. After talking to front desk when booking hotel and being told that we would have two queen bed awaiting us, boy were we wrong. After changing room twice, I had to sleep on end of a full bed while my two boys slept on bed with me, and my husband slept in other bed with our baby. Absolutely ridiculous!!! After complaining and explaining that we would've booked another hotel had we of known we were not going to get two queen size beds the answer from the manager was, sorry there's nothing I can do. We were also lied to by the front desk clerk and was told that the hotel had no other rooms(the hotel was extremely under occupied) and having the manager say the next morning that there were plenty of rooms left?! The second room had a drain problem with the sink and shower, which my husband had to get his dry cleaning hanger and fix drain. When coming in and out of hotel front lobby to come and go the front desk staff paid no attention to us. Once switching hotels to another HI brand hotel we realized quickly what a difference our switch made. We went from rude, non caring workers at this hotel to extremely polite workers at the other hotel. FYI the rooms are small, not updated at all, popcorn ceilings and very outdated bathrooms. Basically felt like staying in a motel.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: lebaneech
Reviews.Content: My third time in NOLA, I picked the hotel I wanted to stay in the first time I visited... This place is in a great location in the French Quarter if you want to walk Canal St, go to the Riverwalk, or do Bourbon St... it's a great hotel for exploring, we had a balcony room (218) with 2 double beds... nothing spectaular but the service was outstanding. Thanks again!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, service and location”
Reviews.Author: Marja-Alain
Reviews.Content: We book in this hotel due to reviews of Tripadvisor and we did not regret it. The location is very nice, close to Bourbon street, but in a more quite street. The check-in was very nice and personal and we received a very nice room. No waiting, our room was ready, all was great. The room was very nice, confortable bed and internet. No remarks at all and I really recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location, Good Price Thru Hotwire!!!”
Reviews.Author: LESIUS_LENHADUS
Reviews.Content: This hotel is cozy and beautiful. The location is the biggest spot. We had a very good rate thru Hotwire. But, breakfast not included. No problem, lots of cafes and places to eat nearby. This hotel is just two blocks from the famous Bourbon Street. The city of New Orleans is just amazing. Saurday is the best day at Bourbon Street. Lots of shows and music. At the hotel you can rest at the pool or just sleep. Our room was a standard 2 double bed. We were three friends, and the double bed should be called one and a half bed. Too small for 2 persons. Amenities were reasonable, but enough. We do not demand too much comfort. Hope you have a great time at New Orleans. For the hotel, we just stayed because we got a great rate, otherwise we would choose another one.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: gwcynthia
Reviews.Content: Got an awesome deal with this hotel on priceline and cannot say enough good things about it. The location is by far the best thing of it. It is close to everything right in the Quarter. Staff was pretty busy but otherwise helpful. Rooms were clean, and not very noisy at all. Will definately stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Who's your Crawdaddy”
Reviews.Author: mamashuz
Reviews.Content: Everything about the hotel was great except the business service center , this is usually a free service but the hotel makes you pay to use the internet . I can see not having people coming in the lobby and signing on but if you are a guest you should be given a code so you can go on for free. I can understand limiting the time to 15 min. a day of something like that but as a priority club member I felt alittle shafted by the fact I had to pay to use the internet. I mean I already was paying for parking $30 a day that should include some free internet time. And there was only 1 computer available. PS small bathrooms because of the type building just in case you are a large person you may want to ask for a handicapped accessible room. Our bathroom you had to walk in beside the toilet to close door . BUT other than that I have no complaints the room was cleaned to a tee everyday and we spent 4 nights there so we were pretty messy. The location was great some of the other Holiday Inn's I passed were in kind of dark alley way type streets this is definately the one to stay at if you are choosing one. No outside noise from Bourbon street which is about 2 blocks over. Never had any problems walking to the hotel or not feeling safe.

Reviews.Title: “fabulous!”
Reviews.Author: debmcd
Reviews.Content: Beautiful spacious room with a balcony overlooking Dauphin St.. Close to great restaurants, shops, etc. Friendly & helpful staff.

Reviews.Title: “Great location if you want to be in the French Quarter”
Reviews.Author: IndianaPeapod
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Chateau Lemoyne for three nights. It was clean, comfortable, and had good service. Because of its location in the French Quarter, parking is a problem, and valet parking is expensive but a necessity for safety. The parking lot is just across the street and is gated. The parking valets are excellent...very fast, very helpful. We had a good stay and would return to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, close to everything, felt safe and secure.”
Reviews.Author: lemingreeley
Reviews.Content: When we arrived we were greeted with the option for Valet (which we took). A bellman arrived in a moment and retrieved our bags and took them inside and waited on us to check in. The front desk only had one person working but no one was waiting and we quickly checked in. The atrium (pool) area was as pretty as could be. The lobby was nicely decorated and it was clean. We checked in and changed clothes and hit the FQ. It is only about 2 blocks from Bourbon street. We felt safe and secure walking to and from the hotel. The location is just perfect. Right off the noisy Bourbon street but close enough and yet still in the FQ. The beds were fine, (not a Westin bed though). The bathrooms are a little small and we had a view of a brick wall. I did get a special rate for booking online but wish I would have received a better view..but then again I wasnâ€™t in the room much at all so it wasnâ€™t a huge deal. We took a dip in the pool and it was very relaxing. When we checked out, again only one person at the front desk, the employee was helping a guy out with his flight info. I think I stood there about 10 minutes before another employee came out, and shuffled around the desk for a few minutes before asking me what he could help me with. Finally checked out and off we go.

Reviews.Title: “well worth going to”
Reviews.Author: kathy123
Reviews.Content: having read some reviews I was worried as we had already booked for this hotel. the hotel is lovely. someone had said there was no lift. there was. while we were there they totally refurbished the reception with new furniture and painted. all the staff were very friendly and helped when needed. one block from bourbon street and no noise heard at all. what an experience bourbon street was. well all of the holidays was. 24/7 bars, dont know how they keep going. went on to see two plantations well worth a look at. enjoyed a ghost tour. we booked this through the hotel. others booked befor we left uk. down the missippi on the boat to the battlefield. some historic facts left out here. 2hr city tour day after we arrived well worth the money. drinks can be expensive but we found some little bars and hotels were only charging $2.50 where as they were $6 in bourbon st. needed earplugs when walking along there and so many different types of music, rock, jazz,creol and many more. oh forgot there is a mens club and at least 4 strip clubs on bourbon st. thoroughly enjoyed it all and would stay at the hotel again. we flew with delta and must say could not fault anything except the 4hr wait at detriot waiting to fly back to heathrow. next time we fly direct.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel! Great Location! Would Recommend!”
Reviews.Author: Azeret
Reviews.Content: This hotel was great! As it was a Holiday Inn I didnâ€™t really have many expectations, but overall it gets 2 thumbs up from me! We arrived way before check in time, but the front desk was still able to accommodate us and gave us a room right away which was nice after a long morning of traveling. Our room was HUGE (one of the biggest I have ever stayed in), and the Bath & Body Works toiletries in the bathroom were a nice touch. All rooms seem to over look the courtyard/pool. The pool is definitely nice to have for cooling off on a hot Louisiana afternoon. The hotel doesnâ€™t offer much in terms of bar/restaurant services, but as they explained to us there are TONS of choices in the neighborhood, so this certainly is not an issue at all. The location is also great as it is a couple blocks from Bourbon Street and also Canal. We walked pretty much everywhere from this hotel and didnâ€™t feel unsafe for even one second. Would recommend this hotel without hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “The French Quarter at its best!!”
Reviews.Author: Marlena5281
Reviews.Content: We were greeted promptly and our room was very special. Part of the original building has been there since the 1800's and we enjoyed the French Quarter atmosphere. One block off Bourbon St. made easy access for walking to places in the Quarter. A very knowledgable staff provided good local places for dining and entertainment. The hotel is winding up an extensive renovation of the property, beautiful lobby, bar and the best of all, Kathleen, the general manager that is accessible to everyone!! Don't miss Chateau Lemoyne on your next trip south. Bob and Debbie Wallace Oklahoma City, OK

Reviews.Title: “Great location one block behind Bourbon...”
Reviews.Author: just_mazza
Reviews.Content: Great location one block behind Bourbon we had a room on the street but it was still quite noisy with street noise, there is no double glazing which would make a difference, but then the windows don't open. The room was large and comfortable, the slightly sloping floor added to the character of the hotel. The bathroom was a bit on the small side. The pool area is located within a picturesque courtyard, but with limited loungers, if you want to see a few sites and then catch some rays you'd be fighting with the sun worshipers! A helpful concierge service.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to stay in NOLA. Close to Bourbon St./Canal Street.”
Reviews.Author: CrispinB2
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel Tuesday to Saturday mid May... Confirmed room at noon (knew check-in was after four) checked bags and headed into town. Very friendly front desk staff and bellman/valet. Concierges could use some more training. Had single King room on 5th floor overlooking side street. large room ample closets, Some parts of the hotel were built in the 1840's! TV very loud when you first turn it on... AC worked but loud if you wanted to have ti running when you slept.Very close to Bourbon street (one street above) and one street away from Canal street. Street where the hotel is on is quite dark and mostly back doors/loading docks leading to Canal street so use caution after dark if travelling alone. I didn't see the value for money during the rate increase and found it kind of out of line to go up $70 on Friday night into Saturday.Very nice courtyard/pool.

Reviews.Title: “Average hotel - no perks”
Reviews.Author: maggie20147
Reviews.Content: Although hotel website says it was remodeled in 2009, it looked to be only the carpet and perhaps beds that were updated. Wallpaper was old. Bathrooms weren't updated much and quite small. Busy street noise was all through the night even though I was told at the time of booking that it's a quiet street at night since it's one-way. Is it quiet anywhere in New Orleans?? No perks hotel whereas you are even charged to use the internet on the one available computer. Desk clerk, however, helped to print our boarding passes but we had to provide him with privacy information to log on website and get boarding passes. Not being able to see the computer screen was a little unnerving as he kept doing it incorrectly. Hotel ONLY serves breakfast and lounge closes very early. Hotel was convenient to Bourbon St. etc.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location”
Reviews.Author: patorlow
Reviews.Content: Recently returned from our first trip to New Orleans. This was the perfect location as it was within walking distance of attractions and the trolley system. There is no need for a car as everything is nearby. The hotel staff were friendly and accomodating and our room was clean and comfortable. Would definately stay there again and would recommend to others.

Reviews.Title: “Loud but big rooms and great location”
Reviews.Author: lisaprosser
Reviews.Content: First of all, if you're in New Orleans and plan on having a quiet, uninterupted nights sleep this is probably not the place for you. Being located one block from Bourbon street it's certainly not the quietest hotel I've ever stayed in. It's not that the walls are thin necessarily, but there did seem to be rowdy partiers in the hallway every night around 4am screaming at the top of their lungs. That being said, it didn't negatively affect our trip at all. The hotel location was super convenient, our room was really big and clean. We had a little balcony, which unfortunately just overlooked a side street, but it was still nice to sit and have a cup of coffee on in the morning. My only real gripe is that we requested a non-smoking room and we got a smoking room because they were all out of non-smoking ones. I did come home with my stuff smelling a bit more like an ash tray than I'd like. But considering how much smoking there is everywhere in New Orleans it wasn't so bad. The staff is very friendly, although being from NYC the slower pace did take some getting used to :) Pros: - great location - big room - clean, comfortable beds - friendly staff - free wifi in-room (this was a HUGE plus for me) Cons: - loud - smoking room - our room didn't have a nice view

Reviews.Title: “Roach Infested”
Reviews.Author: sungela
Reviews.Content: This was the most disgusting hotel experience I've ever had. The place otherwise looked nice, but I walked into my room after dinner and saw a large cockroach, about 4-5 inches long, on the wall and immediately went down to tell the staff to take care of it. Their reaction was "that's not so big for New Orleans" - clearly they weren't surprised. Their response was to send someone up with a Raid can, but after that was was gone, I went back in only to find another smaller, but still quite big, roach ON MY BED. Needless to say, I didn't sleep there that night.

Reviews.Title: “Quaint and Cozy...”
Reviews.Author: skydeeva
Reviews.Content: We were not sure if we were going to be able to dig out from the Blizzard to make our 10 year anniversary trip, but we did. My husband and I found this hotel at the last minute, it was a bit pricey but in all fairness it was Mardi gras! We were lucky to find this hotel. It was cozy and clean from the lobby to the room! After arriving 5 hours late we were greeted with a quick and efficient check in. We were giving our arm bands (Mardi Gras Pee Patrol) and directions to the room. Each room was equipped to handle wireless, however; it was free only in the lobby. We originally thought that we wanted to have a balcony facing the street (WRONG) and were a bit disappointed to find that we had the courtyard view, (THANK GOODNESS)! It was so quiet. I never heard any of our neighbors through the walls, I never heard other guest doors close and I never heard the housekeeping staff until they knocked on the door to see if we needed anything. We had 2 big beautiful French doors that overlooked a well groomed and maintained courtyard. We had 10 foot ceilings, a flat screen TV (NOT HDTV). We were given an accessible room, so we hard large entry doors, and lots of extra space. Trying to watch the weather channel (to make sure we were going to make it back home) there were a few satellite interruptions, but nothing major. The sheets were very clean, the towels and wash clothes in the bathroom were fresh! Small self serve coffee pot, alarm clock and iron w/board in the room. Basic necessities. If you would like a quick bite to eat to get your energy levels up, stop at Annette's Cafe just up the street from the hotel (Nothing Fancy - Just quick good food). She has a small menu with some local cuisine. Be sure to tell Miss Annie on the grill "Rich says hello"! The service is quick; the food is hot and tasty. There is room service at the hotel, but you would probably be better off eating elsewhere. The hotel location is great! You are a 1.5 block from Bourbon and 2 blocks the other way is Canal. It is about a 10 minute walk to Harrah's Casino and The River walk. There is a high end mall just across from Harrah's, but keep in mind the Riverwalk is also a mall and a little less pricey. Be sure to take the trolleys on Canal Street, they are only $1.25 per person and they take you up to the Garden District, Cemeteries and other tourist spots. They have uniformed information assistants stationed at some of the more popular stops. Just let your driver know your final destination and he will let you know when you get close. If your street car approaches and it is full, don't worry there is usually 1 a few minutes behind. Last but not least, New Orleans is a world class city with lots of history and southern charm. It is also just like any other major city with areas that are not safe. So do yourself a favor, do a little history and research before you go and find out what you need to know. With all that said, the Holiday Inn Chateau Leymone Hotel is great! A few blocks away from everything. We will definitely be back!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, everything you need”
Reviews.Author: travel6345
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 4 days on my first visit to New Orleans. It was everything I needed. Fantastic location one block from Bourbon Street, quiet, clean, and had free wireless internet. Whole French Quarter within walking distance. Cafe Du Monde 10-15 minute walk. Canal Street, Frenchmen Street, restaurants, aquarium, WWII museum. Only thing I needed transportation for was to go to the Garden District and it wasn't too far to walk to the St. Charles trolley car to get over there for a couple dollars. If I'm looking for complaints, the hotel cleaning staff policies were kind of strange, they require you to sign something if you don't want them to clean and their do not disturb signs just say come back at 2pm. Received this hotel from hotwire for half the price. Great value.

Reviews.Title: “Great value hotel in good location”
Reviews.Author: middleskoolcrazy
Reviews.Content: This hotel was clean and a good value. It had a charming pool/courtyard area that would be lovely when it's warm. It's located just a block from Bourbon and a few blocks from Canal. Alan the concierge was very nice and had some good tips for us. The room was average, but clean. We had a balcony room, but had to share the balcony with the room next door...kind of weird. It also got a little noisy late at night with it's proximity to Bourbon...to be expected, but probably would not do the balcony room again. We would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Do Not Disturb means what????”
Reviews.Author: dscott12
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this Hotel a couple of times and my biggest complaint is that the Housekeeping people never honor my "do not disturb sign" they started knocking on my door at 10:00am New Years day, obviously I had been out late New Years eve and had consumed a "few" cocktails and was not in the mood when they started "disturbing" me, I told the lady that I did not need service, I hang my towels up after using so I certainly do not need my room cleaned every day, this continued through out my stay. The room was nice and the staff was very helpful and thankfully it's one of the few New Orleans Hotels that still has smoking rooms, I had a late flight out and they let me check out at Noon instead of the usual 11:00am. I would stay here again but I would definately let them know to "Honor" my Do Not Disturb sign ahead of time!! Dave

Reviews.Title: “The Stay was great, was overcharged and took over 3 days for a response”
Reviews.Author: lucylouLouisiana
Reviews.Content: The stay was great. I was overcharged over $200 on my bank card and no one would return my calls. I called guest relations who told me that they could not help me only the general manager who I still dont know who they are!

Reviews.Title: “Staying in New Orleans”
Reviews.Author: Chris32738
Reviews.Content: If you are looking to stay in the French Quarter and want something quaint yet well-appointed the Holiday Inn Chateau Lemoyne is the place. it is only a block from Bourbon St and walkable to anywhere in the Quarter.

Reviews.Title: “perfect!”
Reviews.Author: JamesandCarrie
Reviews.Content: This is a perfect hotel. the location is steps from the boubon street activity, but it is still quiet. it is lovely with beautiful room views of a courtyard. there is simply no comparing the price (i booked through hotwire) with the quality. It far exceeded our expectations and they are doing upgrades to make it even better. I liked the staff, who really went above and beyond their duties. It was very safe, even had an armed guard at night.

Reviews.Title: “Definitely staying here again.”
Reviews.Author: ccpremium
Reviews.Content: Upon check in, we were upgraded to a suite without even asking for it. It had beautiful brick walls and the room was spotless. All the appliances in the bathroom worked and the water pressure was good. The staff was courteous and the conceirge was able to provide good advice regarding restuarants, activities, and nightlife. I mistakenly left a large sum of money and other valuables sitting out when we left the room, yet when we returned our room had been cleaned and all the money and jewelry was right where i left it. The location could not have been better. We were in walking distance to everything, yet away from the noise and drunken crowds of Buorbon street. I've been to New Orleans several times and stayed at a different place each time. However, I will definitely be booking a room at this hotel for all my future visits.

Reviews.Title: “Staff are very helpful - Rooms are okay - Location is pretty good”
Reviews.Author: jspoke
Reviews.Content: If you read Lee200909's review, I think this reviewer had the first room my husband and I were in. I also booked our room for three nights through a very well-known discount online website. The room is wheelchair accessible so the room and the bathroom were huge. I, too, wondered if I was given this room because of the amount I paid for a room. We had to be moved from that room at 4 am in the morning when a very hard rain caused the ceiling to leak in three places. When I called the first time about the first leak, I was told to put a wastepaper can under the leak because maintenance would not be on-site until 8 am. After the second and third leak appeared, I had to go down to the lobby to explain that we only had two trashbins in the room but now had three leaks. That's when we were given a different room just across the hall and free drink coupons for having to switch rooms at that time in the morning. The new (second) room was much smaller, but that was okay with us. We only want two things from a hotel room: clean sheets and a clean, working bathroom. The second room's bathtub drain wasn't draining at all. So on our way out, I stopped and told the person at the front desk. When we got back, the drain had been fixed! The hotel is on the outer edge of the French Quarter. An easy walk to everything in the Quarter but far enough away from all of the noise. As Lee200909 mentioned, the noise in the hotel can be bad. Our first night there was a couple who were having some sort of disagreement. The young woman was pounding so hard on her room's door that I thought she would break the door. Somehow I had slept through the big argument the two had the previous hour (my husband was shocked I hadn't woken up because it was so loud). When I called down to the front desk, I was asked for the womanâ€™s room number. I thought this was a strange request since it was around 2am in the morning, and we were in our PJs. Plus I didnâ€™t really want to be looking out my door at a drunk and angry person. The front desk person wanted the room number so he could call up and tell them to be quiet. She finally left and the rest of our stay was very quiet. There is very minimal staff at this hotel, and even fewer at night. At least I think there is minimal staff at night, because why wouldnâ€™t the front desk person send security up when someone is complaining about someone banging on another guestâ€™s door? The staff that I did encounter were friendly, very helpful, and very conciousous. On our last day, we left the hotel at 8 am. We checked out and were able to leave our bag in their locked baggage room until we returned at 3 pm. They even called a cab for us. All in all, I think I would stay here again for same price I paid. I donâ€™t think I would have been happy if I had paid the â€œnormalâ€� rate.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, needs renovation”
Reviews.Author: Lee200909
Reviews.Content: We checked in last night and already it is a disappointment. The location is great, and it has very nice pool area and lobby. Definitely exotic and New Orleans style. However, room needs updating. Our shower faucet is loose and coming off the wall, and thus, control between shower and tub doesn't work well. Sounds carry very well between the walls - we could hear conversation from next room, from the hallway, and from outside. Air-conditioner is also noisy. We booked this trip through a discount online website (very well-known one), and we do not know if that is the reason, or it is just general lack of service, but we were declined a room change. We're in a handicap unit, which was the only one available when we checked in. When we inquired about the room change this morning, they told us that they are booked solid for tomorrow night and that is the reason for rejecting our request. We didn't want to argue, so we just decided to stay, but aren't they supposed to assign a room they have left at that point when a customer shows up, just like they did to us when they assigned us to a handicap unit? We don't want to spoil our trip by complaining about the hotel - in the end, we have a room in the French Quarter. But I wouldn't recommend this hotel to anyone who look for more than barely minimum. Definitely not a romantic getaway kind of place.

Reviews.Title: “Better than some”
Reviews.Author: Tulanemom_9
Reviews.Content: Hotel lobby is great but like many hotels in New Orleans, rooms are small and the hotel is made up of two or three buildings connected together so halls change elevation, make odd turns and elevators are in strange places. Small lobby bar that had limited hours and tables in a hallway. Parking is valet only and $30 plus taxes.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly and Accommodating Staff”
Reviews.Author: BMak1031
Reviews.Content: This hotel is just a step shy from the main road. It's tucked away but not exactly off a beaten path. It's still easy to get to where the noise and fun is. Upon arrival the we were assisted with our bags and checked in quickly. Rooms were clean and accommodations were made without giving us a hard time or expecting a tip. Even when we had a late flight out, they would secure our bags in the front till we're ready to go.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location! Nice Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: dakunst
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for 4 nights in August. The hotel was just what I expected from the photos. The rooms were very clean and spacious. The rest of the hotel was also kept very clean and the staff was helpful. When we checked in the management told us they were in the middle of upgrades, so there may be some construction or glitches. It was nothing that bothered me, plus August is the slow season, so they have to do it sometime. It's nice to see that they are making changes to keep it fresh. They were painting, installing new door locks and plasma TVs in all rooms. The location is also fantastic. You easily walk to everything, including Bourbon St., Harrah's and Riverwalk. I also liked the fact that this hotel is an old building, giving it character, compared to some high rise hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Liked the hotel but disappointed there was scaffolding RIGHT OUT MY WINDOW”
Reviews.Author: nilesdayton
Reviews.Content: It was my second trip to NOLA (been there once for Mardi Gras, pre Katrina) and my bf's first so we were both excited. Selected Chateau Le Moyne because of a great expedia rate. We got airfare and three nights for $350. I guess I truly can't complain. BUT while we found the room to be spacious and the staff EXTREMELY friendly and helpful (they were really great), the walls were pretty thin and there was renovation going on while we there. Also, aside from the scaffolding, our window faced another wall. I guess that's the chance you take when you book super cheap, but sometimes that's the only way a body can travel! Next time I'll do my research and simply call the hotel directly and ask if there's any work going on at the property. Other than that, the location was great .... it wasn't on Bourbon Street with all the noise but just around the corner from everything. Very walkable. The courtyard/pool (smallish) area was nice but towels weren't cleaned up as quickly as I thought appropriate. I'd love to visit again and stay in this hotel, preferably in a room with a view of the courtyard.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, comfortable hotel”
Reviews.Author: AngHall
Reviews.Content: One block from Bourbon Street, and easy walking distance from many other attractions. Hotel very comfortable, good facilities. Excellent for couples and families.

Reviews.Title: “do not try to take an afternoon nap”
Reviews.Author: dsestep
Reviews.Content: When my husband and I first arrived everything appeared ok. We booked this 3 star hotel mostly for the pool and location.
